programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger

programme.desc: The crew tries to thwart a hijack attempt, but the alien criminal avoids detection by hiding his consciousness in the brain of someone on board

programme.title: Eye of the Beast (2007)
programme.desc: A scientist travels to a small Canadian fishing village to investigate a series of mysterious disturbances, and discovers a ravenous giant squid is hunting in the region. With the townsfolk reliant on the sea for their livelihoods, desperate measures must be taken to rid the area of the tentacled monster once and for all. Thriller, starring James Van Der Beek and Alexandra Castillo

programme.title: Tombstone: The Town Too Tough to Die (1942)
programme.desc: Famous gunslinger Wyatt Earp arrives in the anarchic old West town, and the murder of a child compels him to enforce law and order. He is deputised as a lawman and, with the aid of his brothers, brings the criminal element in Tombstone to justice, culminating in the infamous showdown at the OK Corral. Western, with Richard Dix and Edgar Buchanan

programme.title: Star Trek
programme.desc: The Enterprise is hijacked by a group searching for the idyllic planet of Eden, but Kirk is stunned to discover the remarkable truth about the supposedly blissful paradise. Sci-fi adventure, starring William Shatner, Leonard Nimoy and DeForest Kelley

programme.title: Star Trek: Deep Space Nine
programme.desc: Alien delegates from the Gamma Quadrant prefer gambling in the bar to negotiation - and Quark's attempts to cheat them leave him playing a deadly game with the senior officers' lives. Starring Armin Shimerman, Avery Brooks and Nana Visitor

programme.title: Narrow Margin (1990)
programme.desc: A Los Angeles assistant district attorney arrives in Canada to escort the key witness in a gangland murder case back to the States. With two professional hitmen closing in, the pair take a terrifying journey through the Rockies, pursued by the assassins. Thriller remake, starring Gene Hackman, Anne Archer, JT Walsh and James B Sikking

programme.title: The One (2001)
programme.desc: An evil genius embarks on a perilous journey through a multitude of parallel universes in a bid to become all-powerful by killing every other version of him. However, he reckons without the intervention of a maverick cop determined to prevent his bid. Futuristic martial arts adventure, with Jet Li in multiple roles alongside Carla Gugino, Jason Statham and Delroy Lindo

programme.title: The Toybox (2018)
programme.desc: A family visit the desert in their used RV, but become stranded and isolated in the scorching terrain. They soon learn the vehicle holds terrible, haunting secrets, and find themselves in the fight of their lives. Horror, starring Denise Richards, Mischa Barton and Jeff Denton

programme.title: Anna and the Apocalypse (2017)
programme.desc: When a sleepy town is hit by a zombie apocalypse, adventurous student Anna puts her plans for a gap year on hold as she and her friends get locked into a battle for survival. However, it's not all bad, as they also find time to burst into the odd musical number. Comedy horror, starring Ella Hunt, Malcolm Cumming and Sarah Swire

programme.desc: A 16th-century Scottish clansman discovers he is one of a race of immortal warriors who can only be killed by beheading, and who are destined to fight to the death until just one survives. programme.desc: A lawyer callously destroys innocent lives while performing his duties as a witchfinder, earning a terrifying reputation for brutality and injustice. Michael Reeves' 17th-century period horror, with Vincent Price, Ian Ogilvy, Rupert Davies, Patrick Wymark and Hilary Dwyer

In the Made to Measure challenge, the sewers make dresses fit for a '90s supermodel

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Medical doctors, science broadcasters and identical twins Chris and Xand van Tulleken team up to research their family tree. They grew up surrounded by old paintings and documents commemorating characters from their Dutch ancestry, but despite this wealth of family archive, the twins know little about their heritage. Their journey takes them back to the Netherlands, where they look into the career of sea captain Jan Tulleken, their four-times great-grandfather, a staunch royalist who joined the Dutch navy at 13. But as they trace the story back, they reveal a troubling story

programme.title: The Railway Man (2013)
programme.desc: A traumatised former prisoner of war gets married, but continues to suffer nightmares about his experiences. He is unable to talk to his wife about his time in captivity, so she tracks down a fellow hostage to learn the truth - and discovers the cruel Japanese officer he is fixated on is still alive. Fact-based drama, starring Colin Firth, Nicole Kidman and Stellan Skarsgard

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Live coverage of the fourth day from the All England Club, featuring the second round of the men's and ladies' singles competitions. British hope Katie Boulter was first up on Centre Court on day four last year and she delighted the home crowd with a 3-6, 7-6, 6-4 victory over 2021 runner-up Karolina Pliskova. She was followed by 22-time Grand Slam-winner Rafael Nadal, who prevailed 6-4, 6-4, 4-6, 6-3 against Ricardas Berankis. Meanwhile, fourth seed Stefanos Tsitsipas was in good form as he overcame Jordan Thompson 6-2, 6-3, 7-5

Meanwhile, on the No. 1 Court, Great Britain's Jack Draper lost 5-7, 7-6, 6-2, 6-3 to Australian Alex De Minaur

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Comedian and actress Emily Atack already knows she has showbusiness in her blood - her mother is singer and impressionist Kate Robbins, and Paul McCartney is her grandmother's cousin. Now she wants to learn more about her entertainment roots. Along the way she visits Liverpool to hear more about the McCartneys, and is also told tales of theatrical whistlers, Welsh footballers and Yorkshire miners. Anecdotes regarding struggles with mental health still resonate 130 years later. Narrated by Phil Davis

programme.desc: Isa Guha and Clare Balding present live coverage of the fifth day from the All England Club, featuring third-round matches in the men's and ladies' singles competitions. Novak Djokovic then continued his march to a fourth successive Wimbledon title with a 6-0, 6-3, 6-4 victory over his Serbian compatriot Miomir Kecmanovic

programme.desc: Further live coverage of the fifth day from the All England Club, featuring third-round matches in the men's and ladies' singles competitions. There was also disappointment for Johnson's veteran compatriot John Isner on the No.2 Court, when he was defeated 6-4, 7-6, 6-3 by talented Italian Jannik Sinner

programme.title: Not Going Out

Desperate for a more adequate explanation, he decides to claim the youngster was due to attend a dental check-up. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton, with Selina Griffiths

programme.title: Queen of Oz
programme.desc: After running into her old school bully Jessica, at the opening of a new maternity ward, Georgie decides to host a dinner party for her in the hopes that she can revel in her former aggressor's life struggles since they last met. Unfortunately for Georgie, it turns out that Jessica's life has been a charmed one. As tensions rise, Georgie is forced to confront old grudges and the night soon takes a downward turn. Comedy, starring Catherine Tate

However, when they kill a would-be rapist in self-defence, they make a fateful decision to run from the law, sparking a chain of events destined to end in tragedy. Ridley Scott's drama, starring Geena Davis, Susan Sarandon, Harvey Keitel, Michael Madsen and Brad Pitt

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo ventures deep underground onto London's newest railway - the Elizabeth Line - enjoying a smooth ride from Paddington to Tottenham Court Road. Emerging into the sunshine in Bedford Square, Michael recalls the choking smogs which plagued the capital during the 1950s. He learns how smoke-free zones were introduced to tackle the problem and, high above the capital at the top of the BT Tower, discovers how the capital's air quality is monitored today

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Live coverage of the third day from the All England Club, featuring the second round of the men's and ladies' singles competitions. Novak Djokovic continued his march to a fourth successive title at this stage last year with a routine 6-1, 6-4, 6-2 victory over Thanasi Kokkinakis on Centre Court. Over on the No.1 Court, there was an upset when second seed Anett Kontaveit was beaten 6-4, 6-0 by Jule Niemeier in her first match against a top 10 player. That match was followed by a 7-6, 7-5 win for 2021 runner-up Karolina Pliskova against Tereza Martincova. Meanwhile, there were mixed fortunes for two former champions on Court No.2, with Garbine Muguruza losing 6-4, 6-0 to Greet Minnen, and Angelique Kerber prevailing 6-3, 6-3 against Magda Linette

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Rivers
programme.desc: Paul Murton explores the River Annan in Dumfries and Galloway, following it from where it rises above the Devil's Beef Tub, all the way to the Solway Firth. On the way he samples some dubious-smelling 'healthy' spa water, discovers the explosive devil's porridge and follows in the footsteps of Robert Burns by taking a dunk in the briny close to where the river meets the sea. He then turns his attention to the Esk, which rises in the Portland Hills just south of Edinburgh

programme.desc: The BBC's world affairs editor reflects on the week's major global news stories, talking to local experts from around the world to go behind the headlines

programme.title: Inside the Iranian Uprising
programme.desc: In September 2022, a 22-year-old Iranian woman, Mahsa Amini, died in police custody. She had been arrested by Iran's religious police, accused of not wearing her hijab properly. The authorities said she had died of a heart attack, but rumours spread that she had been beaten on arrest. Furious citizens took to the streets in their thousands. In a country with no freedom of speech or free reporting, they filmed themselves. This documentary reveals what has been happening across Iran, revealing a regime under huge pressure, resorting to extreme cruelty to control its citizens

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: The team follow first-time deaf festival-goers at Glastonbury, as well as those who have been going for 42 years. programme.title: Big Little Crimes
programme.desc: An everyday burglary solves a series of dramatic ram-raids, a minor theft leads to a kidnapping conviction, and a consumer complaint leads to the arrest of prolific fraudsters

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels though Cumbria, setting sail in a small craft on Lake Windermere with a lifelong devotee of Arthur Ransome's children's books Swallows and Amazons. At Barrow-in-Furness, Michael investigates the mountains of scrap left behind as iron ore was turned into ships, trains and railway tracks, and discovers researchers are exploring how slagbanks could contribute to reducing atmospheric carbon dioxide.

programme.desc: Isa Guha and Clare Balding present live coverage of the fourth day from the All England Club, featuring the second round of the men's and ladies' singles competitions. Eventual runner-up Nick Kyrgios was at his swashbuckling best at this stage last year as he prevailed 6-2, 6-3, 6-1 against Filip Krajinovic, while top ladies' seed Iga Swiatek won 6-4, 4-6, 6-3 against lucky loser Lesley Pattinama Kerkhove. programme.desc: Stacey and Martin panic when Lily is rushed to the hospital and Ravi and Chelsea contemplate whether they could have a future together. Jack and Denise give Howie a special birthday present and Kat tries to right her wrongs

programme.title: Our NHS: A Hidden History
programme.desc: David Olusoga explores the hidden history of the nurses, doctors and health workers who, for more than 70 years, have been arriving from overseas to serve in the NHS. Without them the NHS would have been in danger of collapse - not least during the current Covid-19 crisis. From its origins, the story of this beloved institution has been intertwined with one of the most divisive social and political issue of the age - immigration - and those who came to work in the NHS have found themselves fighting battles of hostility they neither sought nor expected. However, as Olusoga reveals, their stories say as much about perseverance, dedication and the overcoming of obstacles as they do about discrimination and prejudice

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc: Extraordinary relationships among the creatures of the ocean, from spider crabs watching each other's backs for predators while they shed their shells, to fish cleaning the skins and teeth of hammerhead sharks. Off the coast of Costa Rica, a team of spy cameras capture a megapod of spinner dolphins, numbering in their thousands, working together to drive the flying fish from below while tuna and frigate birds pursue them in the air

programme.title: A Wright Family Holiday
programme.desc: Reality TV star Mark Wright embarks on an epic road trip across Britain in the company of his brother Josh and father Big Mark. Along the way they open up about things that they've never spoken about before. For Mark it's a chance to reconnect focus on the things in life that really matter, Big Mark wants to regain his confidence after almost losing his life to Covid, while for Josh, it's a chance to experience things he was never able to do while he was a professional footballer. Among other things, they tackle a white-knuckle mountain bike ride, sleep in an abandoned slate mine and reflect on a tough few years

programme.title: Inside the Iranian Uprising
programme.desc: In September 2022, a 22-year-old Iranian woman, Mahsa Amini, died in police custody. She had been arrested by Iran's religious police, accused of not wearing her hijab properly. The authorities said she had died of a heart attack, but rumours spread that she had been beaten on arrest. Furious citizens took to the streets in their thousands. In a country with no freedom of speech or free reporting, they filmed themselves. This documentary reveals what has been happening across Iran, revealing a regime under huge pressure, resorting to extreme cruelty to control its citizens

programme.title: The Trouble with Kanye
programme.desc: Award-winning journalist Mobeen Azhar investigates one of music's most troubling stories. Unfolding against the backdrop of Ye's recent behaviour and his rumoured 2024 presidential campaign, this feature documentary sees Azhar travel to the United States to try to discover how one of America's most celebrated artists became a megaphone for hate and division. Tracing a line from earlier controversies in his career to this current moment, Mobeen speaks to Dr Marcus Hunter about the impact of some of Ye's earlier statements, and explores the bigger picture- a surge of white nationalism and antisemitism across America and the world

programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: The NHS: A People's History
programme.desc: Patients and staff tell their stories from 1997 to the present day, a period in which the NHS has grown unwieldy and almost impossibly expensive to manage. A host of unique, highly personal artefacts, are unearthed, including the homemade badges dedicated to the first surgeons to carry out gender reassignment surgery after it became available on the NHS and a nurse's uniform cherished since it was used in the opening ceremony of the 2012 Olympics

programme.title: Florence Nightingale: Nursing Pioneer
programme.desc: A profile of the woman who revolutionised modern nursing and reformed healthcare at home and abroad. The documentary follows her life, from being born into a rich English family, and revealing how she broke through social and gender barriers to pioneer a profession previously reserved for men. Dedicating her life to helping those in need, she was a trailblazer who led a group of nurses to care for wounded soldiers during the Crimean War and developed revolutionary views about hygiene and sanitation, going on to establish a training school and reform healthcare at home and abroad

programme.title: Black Nurses: The Women Who Saved the NHS
programme.desc: The story of the thousands of Caribbean and African women who answered the call more than 70 years ago to come to the UK and help build the National Health Service. Told by the women themselves, the documentary reveals the price they paid in leaving behind their families, and examines their struggle to overcome racism and their fight for career progression, as well as their cultural impact here and abroad

programme.title: Food for Ravens
programme.desc: Play focusing on Nye Bevan's final days as he muses on his life and career from his death bed in Buckinghamshire. Taking its title from a seventh-century Welsh poem, the representation shows the complexities of the man who, although rooted in the working class, was deeply influenced by glamorous world figures. Brian Cox stars in this 2008 drama, being shown again to mark the 75th anniversary of the NHS

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc: The documentary exploring health care before the arrival of the NHS concludes, revealing how Victorian hospitals - often seen as a last resort for the destitute rather than a place of healing - transformed into the modern centres of medicine they have become today. Includes archive footage and first-hand accounts from patients, doctors and nurses from an era when infectious disease was virtually untreatable. Narrated by Robert Winston

programme.title: Florence Nightingale: Nursing Pioneer
programme.desc: A profile of the woman who revolutionised modern nursing and reformed healthcare at home and abroad. The documentary follows her life, from being born into a rich English family, and revealing how she broke through social and gender barriers to pioneer a profession previously reserved for men. Dedicating her life to helping those in need, she was a trailblazer who led a group of nurses to care for wounded soldiers during the Crimean War and developed revolutionary views about hygiene and sanitation, going on to establish a training school and reform healthcare at home and abroad

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc: Looking at the surprising story of the diesel engine - a 19th-century invention that is the hidden powerhouse behind the globalised world and is now indispensable. Car enthusiast Mark Evans gets hands on with Rudolf Diesel's original creation, including vintage submarines, tractors, locomotive trains and container ships

programme.title: The NHS: A People's History

programme.desc: England v Australia. Action from the first day of the Third Test in the five-match series, held at Headingley Stadium in Leeds. The sides last met here in this format in 2019, when England prevailed by one wicket, with current captain Ben Stokes inspiring with both bat and ball

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Documentary telling how the world's smallest animals manage to survive, revealing how they have evolved extraordinary skills and achieved mindboggling feats. From the animal kingdom's greatest artist to the tiny creatures that provide people with so much of the air they breathe, the programme discovers what it takes to be a miniature miracle. Hugh Dennis narrates

programme.title: Bridge of Spies (2015)
programme.desc: A lawyer in 1950s New York is hired to represent a Soviet spy in a showcase trial designed to demonstrate the fairness of the US justice system. In the face of public condemnation, he argues against the death penalty, a stance that years later leads to his involvement in an exchange of prisoners in East Germany. Steven Spielberg's fact-based Cold War drama, starring Tom Hanks and an Oscar-winning Mark Rylance

programme.title: Escape to Athena (1979)
programme.desc: Second World War Allied PoWs incarcerated on a Greek island plan to defy the SS by breaking out of prison and pulling off an art robbery, with the help of their liberal-minded camp commandant. Action adventure, with Roger Moore, David Niven, Telly Savalas, Elliott Gould, Stefanie Powers and Claudia Cardinale

programme.desc: England v Australia. Action from the second day of the Third Test in the five-match series, held at Headingley Stadium in Leeds. England have won their last four Tests at this venue, including a one-wicket triumph over the Aussies in 2019

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Simon Bates and Richard Skinner present the July 4 edition, featuring Tears for Fears, Simply Red, Dead or Alive, Fine Young Cannibals and the Damned

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Gary Davies introduces performances by Shakin' Stevens, A-ha, Black, Genesis, Jackie Wilson, Mel & Kim, Heart, the Christians, Pet Shop Boys and Terence Trent D'Arby in an edition first aired on July 9

programme.title: Radio 2 in Concert
programme.desc: Back in 1985, A-ha released their debut album, Hunting High and Low, and went on to take the UK charts by storm with smash hits that included Take On Me and The Sun Always Shines on TV. In 2010, the multi-platinum-selling trio retired, only to regroup five years later with the album Cast in Steel. To celebrate the reunion, the BBC Radio Theatre opened its doors to the Norwegian band for this Radio 2 special, in which they play a selection of songs old and new. Presented by Jo Whiley

programme.title: Radio 2 in Concert
programme.desc: A performance by the band at the BBC Radio Theatre in London. After a brief spell in a mod band, Roland Orzabal and Curt Smith formed a synth-pop duo in the early 1980s and achieved huge success on both sides of the Atlantic. As a result of such a huge fan base over 30,000 people applied to be part of the audience for this intimate gig. Here, the boys from Bath perform their classic hits, including Mad World, Shout, Everybody Wants to Rule the World and Sowing the Seeds of Love

programme.title: Annie Lennox: BBC One Sessions
programme.desc: The Academy Award-winning singer performs at LSO St Luke's, London, with members of the BBC Concert Orchestra. The session includes songs from the Eurythmics' back catalogue, together with material from her solo career. First shown in 2009

programme.title: Depeche Mode at 6 Music Festival 2017
programme.desc: Highlights of the band's headlining performance at the Barrowland Ballroom in Glasgow. The electro-pioneers' first live UK show in four years saw them perform tracks from their 2017 album Spirit, along with a few classic hits. The last time Dave Gahan, Martin Gore and Andy Fletcher performed at the 2,000 capacity venue was in 1984 for their Some Great Reward tour

programme.title: The Old Grey Whistle Test
programme.desc: Annie Nightingale presents a Christmas Eve performance by the punk princess at the Theatre Royal, Drury Lane, with a band including acclaimed drummer Simon Phillips. Songs include the hits It's a Mystery and I Want to Be Free

programme.title: Radio 2 in Concert
programme.desc: Back in 1985, A-ha released their debut album, Hunting High and Low, and went on to take the UK charts by storm with smash hits that included Take On Me and The Sun Always Shines on TV. programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The National Health Service is turning 75, and we are celebrating! In this special episode, Dr Xand discovers a time machine inside the cupboard of everything and embarks upon a journey through time with Mr Grumbles. He finds out what life was like before the NHS, and how its arrival changed the health of people all over the UK. Dr Chris catches up with Ouchers to hear their NHS stories, and Dr Ronx is on a mission to award Ouch Hero medals to thank incredible hospital staff for their service. Happy birthday, NHS!

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: How did the NHS come into being? When was the first kidney transplant? Is half a chicken actually a cure for anything? Find out as comedian and former psychiatric nurse Jo Brand joins Rattus to host a special episode in honour of the NHSs 75th birthday. They discover how the NHS came to be, some of its weirder moments, and what life was like before we had the NHS to look after us. Did you know that before the NHS, getting medical help could be both difficult and expensive? We take a look at the role of the almoner, who decided who would have to pay for their treatment, and how much, before Nye Bevan comes along with his notion of free health care for all. We learn the story of the first NHS baby (and how she was encouraged to wait a few minutes before actually coming into the world), of how nurses were recruited in large numbers and how, with ventures such as the Common Cold Unit, the NHS tried to learn about how our health could be improved using some weird and wonderful methods. In

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Plastic is one of the greatest inventions in human history. It makes so much of our lives possible, but how we dispose of it is now a massive problem. By the year 2050 it's thought that there will be more plastic than fish in our seas. So what can we do about it? First, ditch the disposable plastic water bottle and go for tap water in a reusable bottle. Better for the environment and cheaper too! Next, join a beach clean. It may seem like this problem is too big for us to handle but many hands make light work. Reduce, reuse and, importantly, recycle. And even more importantly than that, don't drop litter. A bag that is thrown on the streets of London could end up on the coast of Africa or in the belly of a whale or a turtle. Lastly and most importantly, know that every single person can make a difference. One single plastic bag could choke a turtle or sunfish. One plastic straw could be the end of a gorgeous, iconic animal, so know you have power and use it.

programme.desc: Isa Guha presents live coverage of the third day from the All England Club, where the second round is scheduled to get under way in the men's and ladies' singles competitions. Third seed Casper Ruud was an early casualty on day three last year, losing 3-6, 6-2, 7-5, 6-4 to Ugo Humbert

programme.desc: King Charles III and Queen Camilla are presented with the Honours of Scotland

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Isa Guha presents further live coverage of the third day from the All England Club, featuring second-round matches in the men's and ladies' singles competitions. British number one Emma Raducanu's tournament came to an abrupt end at this stage last year when she was beaten 6-3, 6-3 by France's Caroline Garcia. However, there was better news for the home crowd on the No. 1 Court, where ninth seed Cameron Norrie prevailed in five sets against Jaume Munar of Spain

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents, as live coverage of the third day concludes at the All England Club, where second-round matches in the men's and ladies' singles competitions take place. Two-time champion and home favourite Andy Murray's tournament came to an end at this stage last year on Centre Court when he was beaten in four sets by American John Isner, who is perhaps best known for winning the longest professional tennis match in history here in 2010 against Nicolas Mahut

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: As they compete for a place in the quarter final, Sara Pascoe takes the sewers back to the 1990s. In the Pattern Challenge, the competitors make the most popular trousers of the decade, cargo pants, before rustling up a '90s celebrity-themed fancy dress outfit in the Transformation Challenge. In the Made to Measure challenge, the sewers make dresses fit for a '90s supermodel

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Kiri's TV Flashback
programme.desc: Kiri Pritchard-McLean rewinds the most engaging clips from half a century of Welsh TV, this time looking at Ynys Mn or Anglesey. From stunning scenery to marvellous characters, she finds out how the place she calls home has made an impact in Wales

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Medical doctors, science broadcasters and identical twins Chris and Xand van Tulleken team up to research their family tree. They grew up surrounded by old paintings and documents commemorating characters from their Dutch ancestry, but despite this wealth of family archive, the twins know little about their heritage. Their journey takes them back to the Netherlands, where they look into the career of sea captain Jan Tulleken, their four-times great-grandfather, a staunch royalist who joined the Dutch navy at 13. But as they trace the story back, they reveal a troubling story

programme.title: The Railway Man (2013)
programme.desc: A traumatised former prisoner of war gets married, but continues to suffer nightmares about his experiences. He is unable to talk to his wife about his time in captivity, so she tracks down a fellow hostage to learn the truth - and discovers the cruel Japanese officer he is fixated on is still alive. Fact-based drama, starring Colin Firth, Nicole Kidman and Stellan Skarsgard

programme.desc: Live coverage of the fourth day from the All England Club, featuring the second round of the men's and ladies' singles competitions. British hope Katie Boulter was first up on Centre Court on day four last year and she delighted the home crowd with a 3-6, 7-6, 6-4 victory over 2021 runner-up Karolina Pliskova. programme.desc: Clare Balding presents further live coverage of the fourth day from the All England Club, where the second round is scheduled to conclude in the men's and ladies' singles competitions. Meanwhile, on the No. 1 Court, Great Britain's Jack Draper lost 5-7, 7-6, 6-2, 6-3 to Australian Alex De Minaur

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Comedian and actress Emily Atack already knows she has showbusiness in her blood - her mother is singer and impressionist Kate Robbins, and Paul McCartney is her grandmother's cousin. Now she wants to learn more about her entertainment roots. Along the way she visits Liverpool to hear more about the McCartneys, and is also told tales of theatrical whistlers, Welsh footballers and Yorkshire miners. Anecdotes regarding struggles with mental health still resonate 130 years later. Narrated by Phil Davis

programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the fifth day from the All England Club, featuring third-round matches in the men's and ladies' singles competitions. Cameron Norrie maintained British interest in the men's event at this stage last year with a dominant 6-4, 6-1, 6-0 win against America's Steve Johnson. There was also disappointment for Johnson's veteran compatriot John Isner on the No.2 Court, when he was defeated 6-4, 7-6, 6-3 by talented Italian Jannik Sinner

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Keen to take advantage of free tickets to Adventure Canyon Theme Park, Lee takes Mollie out of school for a day and gets into trouble with her new head teacher, Miss Anstis. Desperate for a more adequate explanation, he decides to claim the youngster was due to attend a dental check-up. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton, with Selina Griffiths

programme.title: Queen of Oz
programme.desc: After running into her old school bully Jessica, at the opening of a new maternity ward, Georgie decides to host a dinner party for her in the hopes that she can revel in her former aggressor's life struggles since they last met. Unfortunately for Georgie, it turns out that Jessica's life has been a charmed one. As tensions rise, Georgie is forced to confront old grudges and the night soon takes a downward turn. Comedy, starring Catherine Tate

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Rewind: 60 Years of Welsh Pop
programme.desc: This edition revisits a cultural movement that began in the late 1990s. Welsh music, film and the arts experienced a resurgence and Cool Cymru was born. Stereophonics, Manic Street Preachers and Catatonia were proudly wearing the red dragon of Wales on their sleeve and were making waves across the globe. Super Furry Animals, Gorky's Zygotic Mynci, Feeder and Duffy also made a huge impact on the scene

programme.title: Thelma & Louise (1991)
programme.desc: Two world-weary friends flee their dull dead end lives for a weekend road trip. However, when they kill a would-be rapist in self-defence, they make a fateful decision to run from the law, sparking a chain of events destined to end in tragedy. Ridley Scott's drama, starring Geena Davis, Susan Sarandon, Harvey Keitel, Michael Madsen and Brad Pitt

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Isa Guha and Clare Balding present live coverage of the fifth day from the All England Club, featuring third-round matches in the men's and ladies' singles competitions. Ons Jabeur and Diane Perry were first up on Centre Court on day five last year, with eventual runner-up Jabeur prevailing 6-2, 6-3. Novak Djokovic then continued his march to a fourth successive Wimbledon title with a 6-0, 6-3, 6-4 victory over his Serbian compatriot Miomir Kecmanovic

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the fifth day from the All England Club, featuring third-round matches in the men's and ladies' singles competitions. Cameron Norrie maintained British interest in the men's event at this stage last year with a dominant 6-4, 6-1, 6-0 win against America's Steve Johnson. There was also disappointment for Johnson's veteran compatriot John Isner on the No.2 Court, when he was defeated 6-4, 7-6, 6-3 by talented Italian Jannik Sinner

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Keen to take advantage of free tickets to Adventure Canyon Theme Park, Lee takes Mollie out of school for a day and gets into trouble with her new head teacher, Miss Anstis. programme.title: Queen of Oz
programme.desc: After running into her old school bully Jessica, at the opening of a new maternity ward, Georgie decides to host a dinner party for her in the hopes that she can revel in her former aggressor's life struggles since they last met. Unfortunately for Georgie, it turns out that Jessica's life has been a charmed one. As tensions rise, Georgie is forced to confront old grudges and the night soon takes a downward turn. Comedy, starring Catherine Tate

The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: Ellie Simmonds: Finding My Secret Family
programme.desc: Gold-winning Paralympian swimmer Ellie Simmonds won the nation's hearts when she took part in Strictly Come Dancing, the first person with dwarfism to compete on the show. Ten days after she was born, Ellie was placed for adoption, and has often wondered if this decision was taken after her parents were told she had a disability. Now she wants to find her birth mother, and gain a wider understanding about why children from diverse backgrounds are more likely to be placed for adoption

programme.desc: Nicky Campbell goes in search of the Bay City Rollers - tartan-clad idols from his own home town of Edinburgh who became one of the biggest pop bands of the 1970s - and learns the dark secrets of the abusive Svengali who managed them. He interviews some former members of the band, which took the charts by storm with hits like Shang-A-Lang and Bye Bye Baby, and learns how, as their fame faded, it became clear their manager Tam Paton was not the champion and protector he appeared

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The chef arrives in the riverside town of L'Isle-sur-la-Sorgue in south-eastern France, where his culinary hero Keith Floyd once owned a restaurant. Buying produce from its floating market, and a Floyd-style hat, James sets up his mobile kitchen on a bridge overlooking the river, and cooks peaches pain perdu in the sunshine. Heading back in the direction of the town, James samples some truffle-laden dishes at renowned restaurant La Beaugraviere

programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: To reach the UK's net zero target, the UK will need a green revolution in how we heat and power our homes. After we've faced huge increases to energy bills, are the current low carbon options too costly to install and too hard to maintain? And is the government doing enough to help households meet the cost of going green? Joe Crowley reports

programme.title: Ellie Simmonds: Finding My Secret Family
programme.desc: Gold-winning Paralympian swimmer Ellie Simmonds won the nation's hearts when she took part in Strictly Come Dancing, the first person with dwarfism to compete on the show. Ten days after she was born, Ellie was placed for adoption, and has often wondered if this decision was taken after her parents were told she had a disability. Now she wants to find her birth mother, and gain a wider understanding about why children from diverse backgrounds are more likely to be placed for adoption

programme.desc: Footage of someone sets a record for holding a tarantula in their mouth, as well as bubble blowing, marathon hugging and inserting needles into a person's head

programme.title: Dress to Impress
programme.desc: In Manchester, Jason, Nathan and Jake all hope to impress hotel bookings agent Olivia with their style choices

programme.title: One Tree Hill
programme.desc: Lucas struggles to comfort Peyton when her pregnancy is threatened and Victoria tries to persuade Brooke to come back to work at Clothes Over Bro's. Haley and Nathan clash about taking Jamie out of his school and Mouth sets out to make amends with Millicent

programme.title: Dawson's Creek
programme.desc: Dawson sees Mr Potter dealing drugs and agonises over whether to tell Joey. Mitch learns Gail has been offered a job in Chicago and the Ice House is set on fire by a customer. Meanwhile, Pacey begins to pine for Andie - much to the amusement of his father, who teases him remorselessly

programme.title: Love Bites
programme.desc: Twenty-nine-year-old Benjahmin hopes that his love of good food will help him pick the perfect date as three suitors cook him a three-course meal. Scarlett Moffatt hosts

programme.title: Dress to Impress
programme.desc: Three potential suitors, Brian, Elmo and Michael, compete for the affections of Lauren from Milton Keynes

programme.title: Dinner Date
programme.desc: TV personality Lauren Simon is given five menus, each put together by a potential blind date

programme.title: Alan Carr's Epic Gameshow
programme.desc: The comedian hosts an all-star version of Bullseye, with David Seaman, Angela Griffin and Chris Kamara answering the questions and their professional partners Fallon Sherrock, Wayne Mardle and Joe Cullen throwing the darts. The pair who get through to the epic endgame have the chance of winning 30,000 for their chosen charity

programme.title: Chuck
programme.desc: Sarah and Chuck have their first fight and, in an act of avoidance, he embarks on a rogue mission to find his mother's handler. Action comedy, starring Zachary Levi

programme.title: One Tree Hill
programme.desc: Lucas and Peyton undertake a memorable road trip, Brook discovers news that could change Sam's life, and Haley receives an unexpected offer. Guest starring Nick Lachey

programme.title: Dawson's Creek
programme.desc: Dawson meets an alluring woman on his way home from his summer internship. Jen attempts to inject a little politics into school life by trying out for the cheerleading squad and Pacey's ambitious plans to earn extra money spiral out of control. James Van Der Beek stars

programme.title: Dinner Date
programme.desc: TV Personality James Lock is going to be given five menus, each put together by a potential blind date. The five women behind the menus have all come up with a three course meal but James will only be having dinner with three of them. He will choose his dates based on the menus he most likes the look of. But when the dinners have been eaten and the dates are done, who will he want to see for seconds?

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts as contestants Antony Cotton, Matt Dawson and Stacey Dooley 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win 50,000 for the charity of their choice

programme.title: Alan Carr's Epic Gameshow
programme.desc: The comedian takes a trip down memory lane as he presents a series of classic TV game shows, which have all been updated with a new final round offering the contestants a chance to win big. The next four weeks will see Alan in charge of The Price Is Right, Take Your Pick, Strike it Lucky and Bullseye. But tonight he steps into the shoes of much-missed funnyman Bruce Forsyth for Play Your Cards Right, which sees four celebrity couples taking a chance on the turn of a single card. The hopefuls are daytime stalwarts Ruth Langsford and Eamonn Holmes, comedian Chris Ramsey and his wife Rosie, presenter Ore Oduba and his wife Portia, and singer-actress Martine McCutcheon and her husband Jack McManus

programme.title: Superstore
programme.desc: Zephra's new store policies confuse Glenn, a memory lapse causes a rift between Jonah and Garrett, while Cheyenne and Mateo face an unexpected challenge

programme.title: Superstore
programme.desc: Carol's lawyer arrives at Cloud 9 to depose the employees, while Mateo asks Sandra to help him hide the details of his work arrangement, and Garrett's behaviour concerns Dina

programme.title: Love Island
programme.desc: The summer's hottest story continues on Love Island. While the Islanders might be having a blast, everyone knows that the contest for the prize is only going to get tougher

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter wins free petrol for a year and takes the family on a road trip to the Grand Canyon - but despite careful preparation and packing, they manage to leave Stewie behind and have to race back to Quahog to retrieve him

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Brian wins the New England Rising Writer's award, and invites Peter and Lois to Martha's Vineyard for a relaxing holiday, but finds his self-restraint sorely tested by the couple's constant bickering

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Brian seeks out old flame Tracy, afraid he may have lost his last chance at love. To his surprise, she reveals he fathered her son Dylan, and drops the boy off at the Griffins' house. However, Brian's attitude toward parenting leaves Lois and Peter ill at ease with the latest addition to the family

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Stan is horrified when Steve's friend Barry comes close to beating his high-school wrestling record, and enlists Roger's help to defeat him. However, his plan proves to be badly flawed when Roger threatens to claim the record instead

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Stan creates attractive alter ego Phyllis in a desperate bid to bond with his son, but when he takes things too far, Francine is forced to intervene. Elsewhere, a group of men takes advantage of Roger's new limousine service, prompting him to set out on a manhunt to exact revenge. With the guest voices of Sarah Michelle Gellar and Patrick Stewart

programme.title: The Stand Up Sketch Show
programme.desc: Comedy routines with Rhys James, Esther Manito, Luke Kempner, Jack Barry, Axel Blake, Felicity Ward and Huge Davies

programme.title: Shopping with Keith Lemon

The next four weeks will see Alan in charge of The Price Is Right, Take Your Pick, Strike it Lucky and Bullseye. But tonight he steps into the shoes of much-missed funnyman Bruce Forsyth for Play Your Cards Right, which sees four celebrity couples taking a chance on the turn of a single card. But tonight he steps into the shoes of much-missed funnyman Bruce Forsyth for Play Your Cards Right, which sees four celebrity couples taking a chance on the turn of a single card. The hopefuls are daytime stalwarts Ruth Langsford and Eamonn Holmes, comedian Chris Ramsey and his wife Rosie, presenter Ore Oduba and his wife Portia, and singer-actress Martine McCutcheon and her husband Jack McManus

programme.title: Chuck
programme.desc: Sarah, Chuck, Morgan and Casey go undercover in Asia to escape the Belgian. Action comedy, guest starring Richard Chamberlain

programme.title: One Tree Hill
programme.desc: Surprise guests make an appearance at Peyton and Lucas's wedding, while Hayley plays an unexpected role in the ceremony. Drama, guest starring Nick Lachey

programme.title: Dawson's Creek
programme.desc: Eve offers Dawson an advance copy of an important college entrance exam paper - which later goes missing during a fire drill, leading to suspicion and recriminations. James Van Der Beek and Katie Holmes star

programme.title: Dinner Date
programme.desc: Barber and TV personality Dale Mehmet is going to be given five menus, each put together by a potential blind date - the five women behind the menus have all come up with a three-course meal, but Dale will only be having dinner with three of them. He will choose his dates based on the menus he most likes the look of, but when the dinners have been eaten and the dates are done, who will he want to see for seconds?

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts as contestants Tony Audenshaw, Tamzin Outhwaite and Phil Tufnell 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win 50,000 for the charity of their choice

programme.title: Alan Carr's Epic Gameshow
programme.desc: The comedian hosts a revival of classic game show Take Your Pick. A selection of plucky audience members go up against the gong and play the famous Yes/No game as Alan bombards them with hilarious questions. One lucky player will then make it through to the brand-new epic endgame, and could take home a car. The show also features The Chase's Dark Destroyer, Shaun Wallace

programme.title: Superstore
programme.desc: The son of Cloud 9's founder pays a surprise visit and the employees struggle to accommodate his bold ideas. Meanwhile, Jonah and Sandra use social media to investigate bad news

programme.title: Superstore
programme.desc: The employees get their hands on worrying inside information and do all that they can to make the store seem perfect - if only for one day

programme.title: Love Island
programme.desc: Week five of Love Island is nearly over and the temperature is rising again, with another explosive day packed with twists and turns that the contestants never saw coming

programme.title: The Stand Up Sketch Show
programme.desc: Comedy routines courtesy of Glenn Moore, Dan Tiernan, Toussaint Douglass, Laura Smyth, Travis Jay, Ivo Graham, Sharon Wanjohi and Rhys James

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter is forced to return to third grade in a bid to qualify for a promotion at work. Meanwhile, Brian opens a bar with Frank Sinatra Jr and they employ Stewie to make it a success

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Stewie persuades Brian to take it slow with his new girlfriend Carolyn, warning him that women do not like to be rushed - but she grows impatient and goes off with Cleveland instead

programme.desc: Francine ignores her husband's objections and buys Steve the dog he has always wanted. However, when a horrific accident leaves the canine in critical condition, a traumatic memory from his childhood leaves Stan unable to turn off life support

programme.desc: Steve tries to prove his toughness to Stan by adopting the persona of a superhero, while Francine also goes through an identity crisis when she receives news that could change the family for ever

programme.title: Superstore

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Bent on revenge, Vera remains unmoved by Gail's plight and even goes out of her way to make sure her devastated neighbour sees the story she and Jack sold to the newspaper, while Peter prepares to make a confession

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Gail resolves to pull herself together and face the world again, Craig lands in hot water with Tommy, and Karen's confidence takes a knock thanks to Janice's meddling

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: Cash-strapped George knows exactly what he can sell to raise money - but decides not to tell Mildred. Comedy, starring Brian Murphy and Yootha Joyce

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: An old flame of Mildred's turns up at the Roper house, prompting George to blow the cobwebs off his little black book. Comedy, starring Brian Murphy and Yootha Joyce

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Ormerod faces a taxing time when a prison van overturns on the moors. The driver is killed, a guard is seriously injured and one of the convicts escapes, while the others are rounded up and taken for treatment at the hospital, where Ken Hopkirk recognises an old friend. Goodwin fails to diagnose a serious case of post-natal depression - an error which almost ends in tragedy when the mother is found standing perilously close to a cliff edge - and student nurse Samantha Beaumont discovers she has an unexpected love rival. Penultimate episode in the rural medical drama series, starring Robert Daws and Paul Fox

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Ormerod faces a testing time when his father-in-law arrives demanding to know whether he was seeing Dr Weatherill while his late daughter was still alive. Following a heated exchange, it emerges that the disgruntled patriarch has hired a private detective to investigate the couple - but the situation only serves to bring them closer together, culminating in a marriage proposal. At the Royal, a painfully thin girl causes concern for Goodwin - whose green-eyed monster emerges when student nurse Samantha Beaumont agrees to a date with a younger man - and the hospital is evacuated after a suicide victim's corpse is brought in emitting toxic fumes. Medical drama, starring Robert Daws, Amy Robbins, Paul Fox and Anna Madeley

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Merton tries to catch a thief who has been stealing tractors from farms around Aidensfield. Meanwhile, Vernon decides it's time to relieve a few more people of their hard-earned cash, and sets himself up as a horticultural expert and garden designer - but makes the mistake of enlisting David's help

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: There's much excitement in Aidensfield as Lord Ashfordly returns home with his new wife, and the villagers are pleasantly surprised to discover how glamorous and charming she is. However, a series of violent hijackings leaves the newlyweds shaken and in need of protection from Mike - but the intrepid officer's suspicions are aroused by the blushing bride's odd behaviour

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Cain confronts Zoe at Home Farm. Katie is infuriated by a hike in the rent and Daz finds himself up before a youth offender panel

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Charity unsettles Scott, who confronts Zoe, but is taken aback by her shocking confession. Daz manages to land himself in trouble again and Steph struggles to deal with her grief

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Gail heads off to the solicitors full of hope for a bright future without her murderous husband, little realising he's been watching her every move - and has still got a couple of tricks up his sleeve

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: With the children securely bound and gagged in the car, conniving killer Richard explains his final, desperate decision to a terrified Gail - is there any escape?

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: When the sleuth's dentist is found dead just minutes after he leaves his surgery, Chief Inspector Japp believes it to be suicide - but Poirot has reason to think otherwise and embarks on his own investigation. Drama, starring David Suchet

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Mike joins forces with Scotland Yard when a gang of thieves turns up in Aidensfield, apparently plotting to steal a valuable horse from local trainer Kieron Doyle. The heroic copper doggedly pursues his quarry to the detriment of his relationship with Tricia - but tragedy strikes, leaving him heartbroken

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A magistrate does his best to protect a young troublemaker - until an embarrassing connection between the two comes to light. The village mourns the death of Dr Summerbee, who is temporarily replaced by James Alway, while Vernon wonders if he may regret an offer to help old flame Maggie Byrne. Rural police drama, starring Geoffrey Hughes

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: DCI Vera Stanhope investigates the case of murdered entrepreneur Freddie Gill, whose body is found by bailiffs attempting to repossess his house. As she delves into the case, she soon comes to understand that Freddie's professional life is just as turbulent as his family life, and Vera must uncover whether the motive behind Freddie's death comes from the trouble at the heart of his family, a desperate financial crises, or his glances with organised crime. Starring Brenda Blethyn, Kenny Doughty and Jon Morrison

programme.desc: When a 16-year-old girl is found dead in her home, Brooks and Devlin cannot be sure a crime was even committed. Determined the accused is guilty, Steel pursues him with every power available - pushing the boundaries of the law to the limit. Crime drama, guest starring Kevin Doyle (Drop Dead Gorgeous), with Ben Daniels

programme.title: Dempsey and Makepeace

programme.title: Inspector Gadget
programme.desc: CGI-animated update of the classic children's cartoon from the 1980s. Inspector Gadget has finally defeated the cruel Dr Claw and frozen him in an iceberg in the Arctic north - however, his evil nephew Talon thaws him out and infiltrates HQ posing as an agent in training. Meanwhile, Penny has also become an agent in training and now has Brain as her assistant - the Chief then calls Penny to meet Talon, who is the agency's new recruit, and she instantly falls in love with him.

programme.title: What's New Scooby-Doo?
programme.desc: The gang goes undercover on Valentine's Day to find out why teenage couples are disappearing, while Shaggy catches up with an ex-girlfriend. Featuring N-Sync star JC Chasey

programme.title: Scooby-Doo and Guess Who?
programme.desc: Scooby-Doo and the gang are on the case of a Medusa Monster that's stealing priceless vases from millionaire art collectors, like Radley Crown and his beloved mutt. What they don't understand is that Radley Crown and his dog are none other than the Blue Falcon and his dog wonder, Dynomutt (who are setting a trap for the Medusa Monster themselves). When our gang's interference causes the Blue Falcon to be taken by the monster, it's up to Dynomutt to put on his Blue Falcon hat and be the brains of the operation. But, he'll need a new Dog Wonder and he picks Scooby-Doo for the job!

programme.desc: Join Luke Franks in the Mini Movies hub as he journeys into the world of movies and movie-making. Find out how to create animations using a smartphone or tablet in the must-see Masterclass, and Luke also demonstrates how to get steady video shots by creating the must-have movie-making accessory - a camera stand - from items found around the house.

programme.title: Nexo Knights: The Book of Monsters
programme.desc: Animated series. Always afraid to end up poor, Jorah Tightwad is digging up a large portion of his property near his castle to build a vault for his money, but what the Tighty Knighties find as they dig is a whole bunch of Stone Warrior Statues and their leader General Krakenskull, a very cool Stone Knight on a Hellhound. Jorah's advisors advise him to sell the statues, but when Tightwad sells them to Jestro and the Cloud of Monstrox, they bring them to life to find a new Forbidden Power...

Zosia and David have saved hard for their first home and have been living Zosia's parents while they search. They have their hearts set on the popular town of Hitchin and Phil thinks that might be partly why their 380,000 remains unspent

programme.title: Extraordinary Escapes with Sandi Toksvig
programme.desc: Sandi is joined by comedian and author Rosie Jones for a journey round the Midlands exploring the best staycation retreats they have to offer. The pair begin in Rutland where they stay at the Rocket Lodge, an eco-build made of upcycled grain silos that boasts a wood-fired hot-tub, a circular kitchen and a disco bathroom. In the sand dunes on a strip of the Lincolnshire coastline, the duo stay in a rebooted 70s beach house called Sandy Feet where Sandi learns that 'Netflix and chill' doesn't mean what she thinks it does. They end their trip close to the Welsh border on the Walcot Estate in a 200-year-old hideaway known as the Wheelwright's shop that once lived 20 miles away but was dismantled and transported piece by piece before being rebuilt to look exactly the same

programme.title: The Change
programme.desc: Linda bonds with Joy, Carmel and Agnes as they make the final preparations for the Eel Festival but she soon starts to feel guilty about lying to them about Steve and the kids

programme.title: The Change
programme.desc: The Eel Festival arrives and it is looking very different to previous years as the Eel sisters use it as a celebration of what it means to be a woman. The Verderer is made an honorary 'Eel Child' but it's not long before the harmony of the forest is broken

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Luca, a 31-year-old tiler from Essex, is hoping to polish up his love life by visiting the First Dates restaurant, and is keen to prove he's not the 'player' women judge him to be. His date is TV presenter Hayley, who may be confident on camera, but finds dating rather daunting. Next in is 72-year-old retired prison officer Sandie who, having modelled the first police-issue trousers for women, completed a Masters, and written a book, has lived a full life and wants to find someone to share an active retirement with. Her date is 79-year-old tennis coach Chris, who is also on the lookout for someone fit and active

programme.title: Untold: OnlyFans Got Me Fired
programme.desc: Sarah Jayne Dunn and other creators explain how their OnlyFans accounts were the reasons for losing their jobs. This documentary investigates the complexities, risks and potential embarrassment of doing adult video work alongside a traditional job as well as asking what rights adult-content-creators have in the workplace

programme.title: Wonders of the World I Can't See
programme.desc: Chris McCausland visits Jordan in the Middle East with actor, writer and comedian Guz Khan, to visit the magnificent ancient city of Petra. But before they head to the wonder, Chris floats for the first time in his life in the Dead Sea, and the pair almost melt during an intense facial spa treatment. In Petra itself, they haggle with shopkeepers, ride camels and listen to tales told by candlelight, before ending their trip with traditional music and a Bedouin feast

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Joe Lycett heads to the Austro-German border with his guest vacationer Roisin Conaty, spending a couple of days in the fairy-tale city of Salzburg. After checking in to the art-filled Blaue Ganz hotel, they hop into a horse and carriage for a tour of the city and an on-the-go three-course meal. They then embark on a forest-bathing workshop, attempting a series of exercises to reawaken their senses. Day two starts with a homage to Mozart. The duo reflect on the composer's music then sample the city's signature sweet, Mozartkulgen - aka Mozart Balls - a mix of nougat, marzipan and dark chocolate

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The documentary following life inside an A&E department returns. Emergency care nurse Tim reflects on his role and describes the impact his GP father had on his life. Meanwhile, Pam, who has Alzheimer's, is brought in with suspected sepsis. The 82-year-old's daughter Lisa paints a picture of Pam in her early years as a lively, fun-loving woman managing a West End club. Emergency nurse practitioner Maria treats 27-year old Theo, who hurt his knee playing football

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Market trader Russell and retired nurse Nicola kick-off proceedings in Essex and the evening seems to go well with one diner polishing off his own food - and everyone else's. The second night sees proud parents Sophie and Elliot host, but their guests find crab claws in their starter. On the third evening romantic duo Gemma and Glen decide to go for a more refined dining experience in the hope of winning the cash prize of 1,000. However, it's Gemma's love for burlesque that grabs most attention

programme.title: Supermarkets Unwrapped
programme.desc: The Food Unwrapped team take a deep dive into the nation's favourite supermarket aisles. In this first episode, the team chill out in the freezer aisle. Jimmy Doherty investigates why there's more to frozen chips than just potatoes, Helen Lawal learns why frozen ready meals have best-before dates, Briony May Williams gets the inside scoop on soft-scoop ice cream, and Andi Oliver learns how to get the most out of your freezer at home

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: Mike and Megan are a passionate pair of creatives who are attempting to build a modernist house on a modest footprint in Suffolk Park, New South Wales. Mike designed the house himself to include only what they need - and only what they use

programme.desc: Ade Adepitan, Lynsey Hipgrave and Hannah Cockroft present action from St George's Park, featuring the Partially Sighted, Amputee, Blind, Cerebral Palsy, Powerchair and Deaf Cup finals

programme.desc: Simon O'Brien and Henry Cole visit Witney in Oxfordshire, where Henry comes across a tractor that has not run for quite a few years - but poses no problem for restorer Alan

programme.title: Chateau DIY

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: In Alicante, Charlotte Rodriguez and her brother-in-law Damon are searching for a Spanish home for couple Lorraine and Martin from Lanarkshire. Having worked on several renovations in the past, Martin is keen to find somewhere that doesn't need any work, but his budget this time is just 175,000 euros. In Murcia, Darren and Natalie Brown are with fitness fanatics Chris and Cheryl from Glasgow. They're looking for a dream home in the sun that will work as a remote office and somewhere to share with all the family. They are fortunate to possess a healthy budget of 300,000 euros

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer follows the Rev Lovejoy's advice and becomes a missionary on a remote Pacific island, where he soon corrupts the innocent natives by press-ganging them into building a casino. With the guest voice of Betty White

programme.title: Britain's Best Beach Huts
programme.desc: Jay Blades and Laura Jackson continue their hunt for Britain's most luxurious beach huts. Jay starts his journey in Dorset at Britain's most expensive beach huts, where a spot on the sand can set a buyer back a cool half a million pounds. He then heads to Scotland to a smugglers' tunnel to a secret beach hut on the shores of a private bay. Laura discovers a complete wellness centre contained in a handcrafted beach hut in Margate, Kent, before seeing how a building that was the birthplace of telecommunications now offers an extravagant beach hut escape on the west Wales coast

programme.title: Britain's Most Expensive Houses
programme.desc: Sotheby's managing director Guy hopes to secure the listing of a 6.5million 14-bedroom, five-acre Grade II listed manor house mega home onto his books. Aston Tirrold in Oxfordshire boasts six reception rooms, a tennis court and a huge outdoor pool, and has been home to the same family since 1975. Broker Kenrick heads to Camden, north London, to try to secure the listing of an uber-modern glass building apartment with three bedrooms, three bathrooms and a 900-square-ft roof terrace

programme.title: Ghislaine Maxwell: The Making of a Monster
programme.desc: Documentary profile of the sex trafficker, being told over three nights, beginning by delving into her lavish childhood in the shadow of a tyrannical father and examining if this affected the woman she was to become. Her father's death left the family penniless and ostracised, but Ghislaine's move to New York in the early 1990s, and association with a mysterious money manager, enabled her to make a new start. But at what price?

programme.title: Ghislaine Maxwell: The Making of a Monster
programme.desc: The documentary focuses on the shocking contrast between the incredible wealth and power wielded by Ghislaine Maxwell and her partner Jeffrey Epstein in American high society, and the crimes they were committing behind closed doors. They entertained presidents and princes in fabulous properties and on a private island. But there are those who claim Maxwell enticed them into that world only to feed Epstein's sexual aberrations

programme.title: Ghislaine Maxwell: The Making of a Monster
programme.desc: This instalment of the documentary charts events in the steady demise of Ghislaine Maxwell. The socialite narrowly escaped an initial police investigation into the sexual abuse of dozens of underage girls in Epstein's Florida mansion. However, her subsequent rehabilitation as an environmentalist was scuppered when she went on the offensive against an accuser. Lawyers of survivors explain their innovative strategy that forced Ghislaine into a corner. It initiated a domino effect that eventually led to an ultimate reckoning - at the criminal trial that found her guilty in December 2021

programme.title: The Other Side of the Door (2016)
programme.desc: A grieving mother living in India learns of a temple that contains a mysterious portal, through which she would be able to speak to her dead son one last time. She disobeys instructions not to open the portal fully, and disrupts the balance between life and death as the boy's dangerous spirit is unleashed into the world - and worse besides. Horror, starring Sarah Wayne Callies and Jeremy Sisto

programme.title: Jon Snow: A Witness to History
programme.desc: The newsreader shares his unique experiences and what they've taught him about humanity in the course of his decades-long career as a world-renowned reporter and Channel 4 News anchor. Despite a lifetime reporting on large-scale trauma and bloodshed, Jon remains an eternal optimist, while wondering: can an individual really make a difference in this confusing and complicated world?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Florida to help the owners of Fleming, a Danish restaurant in Miami. A husband-and-wife duo bought the business eight years ago in the hope of continuing the place's success, but started losing money rapidly. With a Cuban chef cooking Nordic cuisine and a filthy kitchen, things go from bad to worse until it all comes to a head on relaunch night

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me

In contrast, best mates Matt and Daniel have the money to indulge in luxuries and plenty of time to spend with their children, and Matt even owns a fleet of luxury cars, including a chauffeur-driven Rolls-Royce and a yellow Ferrari

programme.desc: The MasterChef presenter visits Italian capital Rome, which boasts inexpensive cuisine and an unrivalled history that stretches back thousands of years. Jessen James has made millions in business and now trains and mentors businesspeople in sales, marketing and mindset. programme.title: The Railways That Built Britain with Chris Tarrant
programme.desc: The broadcaster examines the role of the railways during the two global conflicts of the 20th century, keeping vital supply lines open and transporting troops to and from the front. In the First World War, railway works were converted into munitions factories and women were employed for these dangerous jobs and their heroic efforts helped win them the vote, while in the Second World War, they were vital in organising the evacuation of a million children and offered underground shelters from air raids

programme.desc: A retired former special forces agent has the job of chauffeuring the son of a controversial Miami politician.
