Action thriller sequel, starring Jason Statham, Alessandro Gassman and Amber Valletta

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Great British Ships
programme.desc: Rob Bell investigates the history of ocean liner the SS Queen Mary, finding out how the largest ship of its day could also become the fastest - achieving speeds that few large ships can match even 80 years later. On the passenger decks, he savours the art deco craftsmanship that made the vessel the much-loved 'floating gentleman's club', where royalty rubbed shoulders with movie stars

programme.title: Rich House, Poor House
programme.desc: Make-up artist Katy, husband Paul and their three young children swap lives, homes and budgets with struggling single mum Nadine, her four-year-old son and her best friend. Katy reveals that she once bought a pair of shoes that cost 1,400 and a Porsche and Aston Martin DB9 sit on the driveway of their luxury house, while Nadine has no car, lives in a tiny flat in Portsmouth and has spending money of just 80 a week

programme.title: The Railways That Built Britain with Chris Tarrant
programme.desc: Chris examines the devastating impact of the Beeching report, which led to half the country's stations and almost a third of the lines being closed. He also looks at how the railways were reinvented for the modern age, and how a new locomotive not only saved the railway network, but reshaped the country

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: A pink mansion in Edinburgh gets a makeover from Ann Maurice and Alistair Appleton. They attempt to give the garishly painted home a more traditional Scottish feel by having it professionally redecorated and toning down the dark, oppressive wooden ceiling over the hallway

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Yesterday's Enemy (1959)
programme.desc: A British officer leading a patrol through the Burmese jungle during the Second World War uses brutal methods to gain vital intelligence from prisoners, to the outrage of a chaplain and war correspondent travelling with them. When the unit is captured by Japanese forces, he faces similar treatment at the hands of his captors. Drama, starring Stanley Baker, Guy Rolfe and Leo McKern

programme.title: Fire Down Below (1957)
programme.desc: Felix and Tony run a tramp steamer together in the West Indies, but their seemingly unshakeable friendship is tossed aside when they both fall in love with the same woman. Tony tries to undermine his rival by exposing his illegal activities, while Felix responds with deadly intent. Romantic drama, with Rita Hayworth, Robert Mitchum and Jack Lemmon

programme.title: Tobruk (1967)
programme.desc: Jewish resistance fighters out to destroy Nazi fuel bunkers during the North African campaign recruit a Canadian major experienced in desert warfare. Risking life and limb, they pose as a German transport detail escorting British prisoners, but it becomes clear that someone in their group is a traitor. Second World War adventure, starring George Peppard, Rock Hudson, Nigel Green and Guy Stockwell

A scientist learns the world is soon to face a global cataclysm that will wipe out the human race, but finds the US president has plans to secretly save a fraction of the population, leaving everyone else to die. A writer learns of this scheme, and as the world is devastated by earthquakes and volcanic eruptions, he tries to get his family to the last safe refuge. Disaster movie, with John Cusack and Chiwetel Ejiofor

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Fallout Interview Special
programme.desc: Stars Tom Cruise, Rebecca Ferguson, Henry Cavill, Simon Pegg, Vanessa Kirby and director Christopher McQuarrie talk about making the sixth instalment in the franchise

programme.title: Mission: Impossible III (2006)
programme.desc: Former secret agent Ethan Hunt is called out of retirement when an ex-trainee is taken hostage by a ruthless arms dealer, but when the rescue operation goes wrong, the villain decides to target Hunt's fiancee. Action thriller sequel directed by JJ Abrams, starring Tom Cruise, Philip Seymour Hoffman, Michelle Monaghan, Ving Rhames and Simon Pegg

programme.title: American Made (2017)
programme.desc: A pilot is recruited to act as a courier for the CIA in the 1980s, carrying out covert deliveries from the US to General Noriega's regime in Panama. However, he exploits the opportunity to set up a profitable sideline trafficking drugs for a cartel. His dangerous double life takes a darker turn when he is ordered to supply weapons to far-right rebel groups operating in Nicaragua. Fact-based comedy drama, starring Tom Cruise and Domhnall Gleeson

programme.title: Demolition (2015)
programme.desc: A successful investment banker is left devastated by the death of his wife. A complaint to a vending machine company sets him off on a letter-writing campaign in which he makes a series of brutally honest personal admissions, providing him with the chance to make a fresh start in his life - as soon as he has finished destroying everything that used to matter to him. Drama, starring Jake Gyllenhaal, Naomi Watts and Chris Cooper

programme.title: Lawrence of Arabia (1962)
programme.desc: An enigmatic British Army officer tries to unite the Arab nations against the Turks during the First World War, but comes into conflict with the military authorities when he engages the enemy with guerrilla tactics instead of more conventional methods. However, his increasingly torn loyalties leave him close to madness. Oscar-winning epic drama directed by David Lean, starring Peter O'Toole, Omar Sharif, Anthony Quinn, Alec Guinness and Jack Hawkins

programme.title: True Grit (1969)
programme.desc: One-eyed, over-the-hill US Marshal Rooster Cogburn reluctantly agrees to help a girl track down her father's killer. The quest is complicated by a Texas Ranger, who is also on the murderer's trail, and a host of villains who have few qualms about disposing of the meddling youngster and her protector. Western, starring an Oscar-winning John Wayne alongside Jeff Corey, Kim Darby, Glen Campbell, Robert Duvall and Dennis Hopper

programme.title: X-Men: Apocalypse (2016)
programme.desc: The mutant heroes face the oldest and most powerful of their kind, an ancient Egyptian tyrant who is restored to life in the 1980s and plans to destroy civilisation and rebuild it in his own image. Awakening after thousands of years, he recruits the disheartened Magneto and other mutants to create a new world order. As the fate of Earth hangs in the balance, Professor X and Raven lead a team of young X-Men to stop their seemingly invincible nemesis from destroying mankind. Superhero adventure sequel, starring James McAvoy, Michael Fassbender, Jennifer Lawrence and Oscar Isaac

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Fallout Interview Special
programme.desc: Stars Tom Cruise, Rebecca Ferguson, Henry Cavill, Simon Pegg, Vanessa Kirby and director Christopher McQuarrie talk about making the sixth instalment in the franchise

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Ghost Protocol (2011)
programme.desc: Secret agent Ethan Hunt and his team are implicated in a bombing at the Kremlin, forcing the American president to declare them fugitives. The spies plan to clear their name by abducting the real terrorist, which leads them into a pursuit around the globe. However, Hunt cannot be sure his colleagues are trustworthy. Action adventure sequel, starring Tom Cruise, Jeremy Renner, Simon Pegg and Paula Patton

programme.title: Valkyrie (2008)
programme.desc: Fact-based thriller, recreating the 1944 plot to assassinate Adolf Hitler using a briefcase bomb. As the tide of the Second World War turns in favour of the Allies, a group of senior German officers recruits war hero Colonel Claus von Stauffenberg to spearhead an attempt on the Fuehrer's life. Starring Tom Cruise, Kenneth Branagh, Bill Nighy and Tom Wilkinson

programme.title: Clash (2016)
programme.desc: Demonstrators from different sides of the political divide are tossed into a police van during Egypt's 2013 street protests. Drama, starring Nelly Karim, Hani Adel and El Sebaii Mohamed. In Arabic with English subtitles

programme.title: Arabian Nights (1942)
programme.desc: The story of two half-brothers - one the heroic caliph, the other an evil usurper - as they do battle for the right to rule their kingdom, and win the hand of beautiful dancer Sherazade. Adaptation of the classic adventure tales, starring Jon Hall, Maria Montez, Sabu and Leif Erickson

programme.title: The File on Thelma Jordon (1950)
programme.desc: An assistant district attorney falls for a woman suspected of murdering her aunt, so he covers up evidence that may incriminate her as he attempts to get her acquitted. Film noir, starring Barbara Stanwyck and Wendell Corey

programme.title: Ten Wanted Men (1955)
programme.desc: A law-abiding Arizona rancher runs into trouble when he unwittingly makes an enemy of a neighbouring landowner, who resents him for having befriended and comforted his abused mistress. The jealous man then recruits nine gunmen in a bid to drive his rival out of the territory. Western, starring Randolph Scott, Richard Boone, Donna Martell and Jocelyn Brando

programme.title: Gideon of Scotland Yard (1958)
programme.desc: Police inspector George Gideon experiences an eventful day's work. He learns one of his detectives has accepted bribes, goes on the trail of a murderous maniac and tracks a woman suspected of robbery. He also helps foil a bank heist and gets off on the wrong foot with an eager young constable. John Ford's drama, starring Jack Hawkins, Dianne Foster, Anna Lee and Anna Massey

programme.title: Sahara (2005)
programme.desc: An explorer stumbles upon evidence that an American Civil War battleship, which was laden with treasure when it sank without trace, has ended up somewhere in the Sahara. However, he is deflected from his mercenary quest to find the hoard by an encounter with a tenacious doctor, whose battle to stop the spread of a deadly disease could be linked to his own mission. Adventure, starring Matthew McConaughey, Penelope Cruz and Steve Zahn

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Fallout Interview Special
programme.desc: Stars Tom Cruise, Rebecca Ferguson, Henry Cavill, Simon Pegg, Vanessa Kirby and director Christopher McQuarrie talk about making the sixth instalment in the franchise

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Rogue Nation (2015)
programme.desc: The team of secret agents faces being shut down when the head of the CIA convinces the US Senate that it is too dangerous. The operatives of the Impossible Mission Force become fugitives when they defy orders and plot to bring down a shadowy society of assassins. Spy thriller sequel, starring Tom Cruise, Jeremy Renner, Rebecca Ferguson and Simon Pegg

programme.title: The Equalizer (2014)
programme.desc: A retired secret agent applies his talents to the task of helping victims of injustice. When he witnesses a prostitute being beaten up by a pimp, he kills the man, an act that draws him into a battle to the death with a Russian crime syndicate. Action thriller based on the 1980s TV series, starring Denzel Washington and Chloe Grace Moretz

programme.title: Drunk Wedding (2015)
programme.desc: A couple's marriage at a resort in Nicaragua is ruined when their college friends get drunk on tequila and the ir big day descends into an orgy of excessive boozing, embarrassing revelations, sexual opportunism and general bad behaviour. Comedy, starring Christian Cooke, Nick P Ross and JR Ramirez

programme.title: Hollyoaks

programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits PJ's Steakhouse in Queens, New York, to provide his expert advice to the owners. They decided to turn a successful bar into a high-end restaurant, but without any previous experience in managing a business they found themselves seriously in debt. With an over-confident chef and a partner propping up the bar, co-owner Madalyn faces a few difficult decisions

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Florida to help the owners of Fleming, a Danish restaurant in Miami. A husband-and-wife duo bought the business eight years ago in the hope of continuing the place's success, but started losing money rapidly. With a Cuban chef cooking Nordic cuisine and a filthy kitchen, things go from bad to worse until it all comes to a head on relaunch night

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: With Dr Sturgis still in a psychiatric hospital, Mary worries about Sheldon's mental health and whether a similar outcome is in his future. Meanwhile, Georgie tries to earn money by selling Texas snow globes. Iain Armitage and Zoe Penny star

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: The prodigy must find a new way to stay academically challenged without the university class run by Dr Sturgis. programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard is torn between his relationship with Bernadette and pleasing his mother - and comes up with a solution that leaves everyone unsatisfied. Leonard rekindles his romance with Raj's sister Priya, while Amy uses Penny's emotions as the basis for a research project

programme.desc: The team explores whether Robert Mead, who died in Thailand, had any relatives in the UK, and a man learns more about his grandfather's past as a member of Kitchener's Army during the First World War. Plus, details of unclaimed estates where heirs still need to be found

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate researchers discover the tragic life story of former soldier Arthur Jones, who left an estate worth 225,000. Plus, a nationwide search gets under way for the relatives of David Johnson, who are set to receive an inheritance of 37,000

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts at Brockley Hall Hotel in Saltburn-by-the-Sea, North Yorkshire, where owner Heather Garcia and manager Sally Lewis hope to impress their guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Alistair Richardson welcomes his rivals to his family owned B&B, The Star Inn 1744, in Thrussington, Leicestershire. The refurbished village pub impresses Steve and Tracy, but Heather and Sally's stay gets off to a far from spotless start

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at Croft Farm Park in Tewkesbury, Gloucestershire, where owners Jason and Michelle Jones are keen to show off their new luxury lodges

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests arrive at Harbour Vista in Poole, Dorset, where most of them have been expecting something lavish - so they are surprised to be staying in owner Steve Webster's house

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time, to find out how much they've been paid and to settle some scores. Heather and Sally from Brockley Hall Hotel want some answers about why one of their rooms didn't scrub up. Plus, Alistair from The Star Inn 1744 queries his guests' cleanliness comments

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Rothschild giraffe Orla is about to give birth to her second calf but is three weeks overdue. This episode captures the arrival of the giraffe family's youngest member and its introduction to the rest of the herd. Cameras also follow the Chester team as they attempt to save mountain chicken frogs from extinction, and there's a look at the secret world of three disruptive aardvarks

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Curious four-month-old terrier puppies Bobo and Lenny start scouting out their new surroundings at the centre. The brother and sister are completely different in looks and personality, but both need a forever home. Meanwhile, the staff bring together 82-year-old Alan and lhasa apso Ruby, both of whom are looking for comfort after losing a loved one

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: For most people, living in a lighthouse is pure fantasy. Not so for Edward and Hazel Short and their two young daughters. Back in 2012, they set out to build a brand new, art deco, shining white lighthouse tower with additional bedrooms, guest rooms, and infinity pool on the side - all on a rugged but beautiful clifftop in North Devon. Kevin McCloud sees if they made that dream a reality

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Sara, 46, is rushed in after a car crash with serious head and chest injuries, and 54 year-old Simon comes in after falling off his bike on his way to buy a helmet. As his condition deteriorates, Simon looks back on his life and the things he wishes he had done differently. Sixteen year-old James comes in with a severed finger after trying to climb a fence

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Three patients and how they cope when life takes an unexpected turn, including a patient who severed three of his fingers with an electric saw. Plus, a man with motor neurone disease is rushed to St George's with severe sepsis, and a teenager struggles to come to terms with the impact of serious injuries he sustained in a car crash six weeks ago

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Fifty-four-year-old James is rushed to A&E after a head on collision with his car windscreen, leaving doctors concerned he may have sustained a serious life changing injury. Elsewhere, Justice waits with his girlfriend Elissa to have a worrying lump on his finger examined

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: Steph is trapped with multiple injuries after a bad smash near Alnwick in Northumberland. An accident with a bonfire leaves Paul with serious burns, while in Norfolk's Thetford Forest it's difficult for the medics to reach horse-rider Alice, who has badly broken her ankle

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics rush to save the life of a cyclist who has been crushed by a lorry in Leamington Spa, and in Coventry, a man is treated after falling from a barge

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Three patients and how they cope when life takes an unexpected turn, including a patient who severed three of his fingers with an electric saw. Plus, a man with motor neurone disease is rushed to St George's with severe sepsis, and a teenager struggles to come to terms with the impact of serious injuries he sustained in a car crash six weeks ago

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty sets out to learn how kippers are produced, and finds out why this nutritious smoked fish is no longer a breakfast favourite. Kate Quilton is in Germany to investigate gherkins, discovering a space-age machine that can pickle food in seconds. Matt Tebbutt and Helen Lawal try to discover why rice cakes are white when they are made of brown rice

programme.title: Kirstie's Vintage Gems
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp teams up with potter Richard Miller to help Ellie and Nick Harrington - who have no practical DIY skills - create plates to complement their 1930s-style dining room in Tunbridge Wells, Kent

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Danni Menzies helps Tina from Chester, who has 160,000 to find a holiday home around the town of Beziers in southern France where she can eventually retire to

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: Documentary following British expats as they set up new businesses in Spain and France. A couple tie the knot at their gite in France, while two friends kick start an e-bike business in Portugal. In the Italian hills, the breaks are slammed on at a house build

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit Cheshire and Wirral, where items include a 1920s dancehall lighting system, an antique butter churn and an old enamel advertising sign

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole is rather taken with a throne salvaged from an exotic nightclub and Simon O'Brien's restoration of a Victorian doll's house fails to go to plan

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The search for heirs to the 250,000 estate of Keith Bryant provides an insight into the tensions of the Cold War. The probate detectives also investigate the case of Rita Mason, who died in West Bromwich in 2010 and may have owned a property worth up to 175,000

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate researchers investigate the case of Evelyn Burgum, who was thought to have emigrated to Canada with her husband George, but may have been living in north London all along. The case of 82-year-old Betty Littlewood proves difficult for the team when it emerges she was an illegitimate child. Plus, details of three more unclaimed estates

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The latest competition kicks off at The Somerset House Hotel in Weymouth, run by couple Adam Borton and Holly Syme, who hope their boutique-style rooms and BBQ breakfast will whet their guests' appetite. Guests Sam and Mandy are blown away by their surroundings, but Belinda and Brenda aren't fans of the noise and find the sofa bed to be a bad bunk. In the morning, the breakfast gets a grilling and Sandeep and Vaishalee's revelations leave the group with high expectations

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to the seaside town of Dawlish in Devon, where the owner of the Knitting Hotel, Belinda Harris-Reid, and her colleague Brenda Watson hope that their guests will get excited about all things woolly. Most of the guests embrace the hotel's theme, but the minimal feel to the rooms leaves Adam and Holly berating the lack of the basics

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week the group heads to Stade Court Hotel in Hythe in Kent, where owners Sandeep and Vaishalee Chawla have a hosting policy of treating their guests like a god. However, some guests have cleanliness concerns, with Holly and Adam having to call in the management

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Mandy McCready and her assistant Sam Gould welcome their rivals to the Goodlife Guest House, a family business in Harwich in Essex. As their guests pull into the car park, the location is met with raised eyebrows but the B&Bers are pleasantly surprised when they see their rooms. During an afternoon of crabbing on Harwich pier, Sandeep and Vaishalee reveal that they're still struggling to shake off Belinda's feedback

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to settle some scores, with Adam Borton and Holly Syme from the Somerset House Hotel keen to put Belinda and Brenda's sleeping issues to bed

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: The Hi Way elephants have been hit with a potentially deadly virus, with the youngest members of the family most at risk, and the keepers and Chester Zoo's veterinary team do all they can to combat the mysterious illness. Meanwhile, Mac the stallion zebra is introduced to the zoo's three mares in the hope they will produce much needed offspring for this endangered species. There's also a look into the bizarre world of the naked mole rat

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Nervous young labrador Loki arrives at the centre, and soon meets seasoned dog owner Sharron, a Royal Navy nurse. But will a recent injury prevent her from taking him in? Small terrier Midnight is also looking for a forever home, although when he is introduced to a couple dealing with the pain of not being able to have children, he only has eyes for one of them

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Steph Wilson and her husband Alex build a contemporary, cantilevered farmhouse on farmlands once owned by her grandfather in Herefordshire. The couple are told their ambitious design will cost 500,000, twice as much as they can borrow, but the pair decide to take a leap of faith and move into a draughty old caravan on site as they begin working on their new home

programme.title: The Great British Dig: History in Your Back Garden
programme.desc: Hugh Dennis and the team visit the village of Strelley in Nottinghamshire, on a quest to find the long-lost medieval castle of a knight from the 14th century. Sampson de Strelley came from a long line of knights and rose to become the Sheriff of Nottinghamshire, but the castle he built has vanished from the landscape

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: The architect advises more people make their period homes fit for modern life. In Clapham, south London, Masum and Maria's Victorian terraced home is no longer working for the three generations of family living there. George also travels to Hove to meet Louis and Sarah, who are tackling the upstairs of their 16th-century gatehouse

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Fifty-four-year-old James is rushed to A&E after a head on collision with his car windscreen, leaving doctors concerned he may have sustained a serious life changing injury. Elsewhere, Justice waits with his girlfriend Elissa to have a worrying lump on his finger examined

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: Medics battle to keep 48-year-old Paul alive as he suffers a series of heart attacks. Roger's emergency stop halts his day at a scooter rally while, in Cumbria, there's a dramatic mountainside rescue for seriously injured cyclist Nick

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: The paramedics fight to save a man whose heart has stopped for more than 50 minutes, and a young boy is found unconscious in a Coventry park after drinking two litres of whisky. Plus in Birmingham, a 93-year-old grandmother is stranded on the floor

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

programme.title: Food Unwrapped

programme.title: Kirstie's Handmade Treasures
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp is taught how to bind books by expert Isabelle Ting, and reveals how to create a notebook from leftover materials including leather offcuts, recycled leather coats and decorative paper

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Donna and Martin, from Dagenham, east London, seek a holiday home for the whole family to enjoy on the stunning Costa Dorada in Spain. They have a budget of 65,000 and want a one-bedroom apartment with outside space close to the bustling town of Salou. Jasmine Harman lines up five properties for them to consider

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: It's moving day for a couple building a house in the Italian hills, while the owners of an e-bike company take out their first paying tour. Meanwhile, in Portugal, a couple bid to finally pull off their longed-for yoga retreat

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien are in Northamptonshire and Coventry, where Henry discovers a rare limited edition Honda Goldwing motorbike with only 65 miles on the clock

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate detectives explore the case of Brett Miller, who died aged just 39, and investigate John Woor's life story, from his time in wartime India to his experiences in the world of art. Plus, details of three more unclaimed estates

programme.title: Heir Hunters

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to Inn at the Park in Aberdeen, where for owners Ronnie and Steph Caird, it's all about keeping it in the family. When the guests arrive, design-conscious father and son Steve and Allard take a trip back in time, and John isn't flushed with praise for his bathroom. At dinner, John reveals his culinary background, piling on the pressure for Ronnie to deliver a good breakfast. Fiona and Shauna's sizeable confession raises eyebrows, while in the morning, Ronnie has a breakfast to forget and the bathroom blues leave Ronnie and Steph seeking answers from their guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to Ingliston Country Club in Renfrewshire, where events manager Shauna Kirk and sales manager Fiona Gallagher prove a force to be reckoned with. Guests Steve and Allard aren't feeling the dated dcor, and John proves that one size doesn't fit all. Ronnie and Steph are blown away by the competition, but they think that perfection comes at a price

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit, the group heads to 1692 Wasdale in the Lake District, where owners Steve and Allard Newell have proudly built their B&B from the ground up

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Cameras follow Chester Zoo's four new fledgling Humboldt penguins who are being brought up apart from the main colony until they're old enough to compete for fish in the main pool. They're keen to make a break for it and join the adults, but when they're finally free to go they have other ideas. Elsewhere, Niall the chimpanzee keeper has known chimp Boris for 44 years. programme.title: The Dog House

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: After a four-year stint living in New Zealand, ex-RAF pilot Jon and GP Gill Flewers want to build a Kiwi-style hill house on the slopes of the Malvern hills in Worcestershire. programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The hospital documentary returns, focusing on the stories of two motorcyclists, which reveal how the bonds between loved ones can be strengthened through adversity. programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: The events of 1944, when the death toll rose substantially. By this point, the Allies were aware of Auschwitz's purpose, and faced a difficult decision over what should be done about it. Plus, the story of the occupation of Hungary, revealing how Adolf Eichmann offered to spare a million Jews in return for certain services

programme.title: World War Weird

programme.desc: Tim Dunn and Siddy Holloway visit the cathedral-like Greenwich Power Station, which stands ready to power the tube at short notice

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his American rail journey west to Jefferson City, Missouri, following the tracks of European settlers in the 19th century. In St Louis he ascends America's monument to the Wild West, the Gateway Arch, the tallest free-standing monument in the US. On the banks of the Missouri River, the political commentator is invited aboard a replica of the original keel boat used for an historic expedition. In Washington, Missouri, Michael tries to craft a corn cob pipe, and in Jefferson City he finds an huge fortified building that served as the gaol for the entire Wild West

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo heads from Warwick to Rye in East Sussex. In the orchards of East Malling, Kent, Michael discovers how the Edwardians' serious attitude towards cultivation bears fruit even now. In Folkestone, he hears how the town coped with an influx of more than 100,000 refugees fleeing the German invasion in 1914. In the High Weald, Michael heads for Tenterden Town and the light railway that opened in 1900. His final stop is the medieval Cinque Port of Rye, where he tours the home and garden of author Henry James

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores the Britain of the 1930s as he sets out on another adventure. Beginning just outside Newcastle in Jarrow, Michael uncovers the desperation that led 200 men to march 300 miles to Westminster in order to petition the government for work. The first leg of his journey ends Spennymoor, Co Durham, where he meets the son of a miner who became one of the most famous 20th-century artists of the region

programme.title: Bangers & Cash
programme.desc: Derek collects a beautifully restored and carefully modified 1936 Wolseley 14/56. Meanwhile, a Batman-inspired Chrysler Crossfire is dropped off at the Thornton le Dale garage

programme.desc: How, in 1940, the French Army suffered a heavy defeat after underestimating the Nazis' strength while relying on First World War strategies and equipment to defend its frontiers. Narrated by Laurence Olivier

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: The third leg of Michael Portillo's journey from Brighton to Cromer begins in the London borough of Enfield, where he visits the Royal Small Arms Factory, the largest machine shop in Europe in the Victorian era. He then discovers the influence of trains on horse racing in Newmarket, and heads to Cambridge to find out why it could be considered the birthplace of football

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson examines the history of the Lancashire village Sunderland Point, which is cut off twice a day by the tide and has become a haven for wildlife. He reveals it was once a busy port that was instrumental in the slave trade, and at the forefront of the luxury goods business that transformed 18th-century Britain.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo is in Northumbria en route to the Highlands, heading to Kielder Forest to discover what lay behind a national initiative to plant one of the largest manmade woodlands in Europe. Crossing the border to Scotland, Michael arrives in the weaving town of Hawick to visit Lovat Mill, where, in the 1930s, tweed was big business, and also goes to the movies, sitting in the front stalls at the Dominion cinema in Morningside

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Following the route of the old Caledonian Railway Company, Michael Portillo discovers the 'Riviera of the Highlands'. With a daily direct train service to Kings Cross, Gleneagles remains a top destination and is also headquarters for the British School of Falconry. Berry Town, aka Blairgowrie, is Michael's next stop. At the home of the Scottish raspberry industry, which once sent fruit to London daily on board a raspberry special service from Cooper Angus station, Michael learns how to pick this most delicate of berries. The last stop on this leg is the city of Dundee, where he visits publisher DC Thomson

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Offbeat tourism show in which Richard Ayoade is joined by celebrity guests to enjoy the most efficient weekend break possible. He begins in Barcelona with comedienne and actress Kathy Burke, experiencing the best of this popular holiday destination in just 48 hours. The pair sample adventurous cuisine, including potatoes coated in edible clay, and a cava tasting session quickly descends into disarray. Other highlights include a visit to the Barcelona Football Club museum, a guided tricycle tour, and a trip to see the surrealist work of Catalan artist Joan Miro

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade is joined by fellow comedian Adam Hills on a whirlwind weekend in Turkey's largest city. He wants to show The Last Leg host how to holiday with ruthless efficiency, as they cross the River Bosphorus from Europe to Asia, comparing a private yacht tour with the low-price public ferry. The pair have an authentic Turkish shave at a local barbershop that turns out to be a lot closer than they were expecting, and share an awkward moment at a local bath and massage parlour. There's also a visit to the Grand Bazaar market, where both men have a go at haggling

programme.desc: War Weekend takes place on the North York Moors Railway, celebrating the part played by the railways during the Second World War, with around 30,000 visitors expected to attend. As it turns out, the biggest battle of the weekend is with the weather, as a storm blights the final preparations. Further complications arise when a tree falls on the line, leading to a full track inspection before any trains are allowed to run. Despite the setbacks, can the team pull off one of their biggest, most important and lucrative events of the year?

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo arrives in Manassas, Virginia, scene of two crucial battles during the American Civil War. In Fredericksburg, he tries bottling bourbon corn whiskey and learns how it became the nation's spirit. In Richmond, the ex-politician enjoys a tour of the Virginia state Capitol building, where he hears of the dilemma faced by one of its most famous sons, General Robert E Lee, before donning his dancing shoes for a Cotillion ball. Michael ends his journey in Jamestown, the first permanent English settlement in North America

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.desc: On the final night of the competition in Cardiff, host Suzanne is pinning her hopes on an evening of sophistication and fine French cuisine. Suzanne's menu is inspired by her many holidays to France - in fact she's been every year for the last 17 years. However, revealing the inspiration behind her starter might be a step too far for her guests, especially after the revelations found inside her 'special' cupboard!

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Ben Hillman helps Ian and Emily find a holiday home in Pollenca, Mallorca on a budget of 440,000

programme.title: Britain's Best Beach Huts
programme.desc: Craftsman Jay Blades and interior design expert Laura Jackson travel the coastline as they compete to find the best beach huts Britain has to offer. Jay starts his adventures in Norfolk, meeting a fellow craftsman who's created a multi-coloured patchwork hut made of driftwood, before heading to Herne Bay where wedding bells are in the air at a beach hut on the pier. Laura's choices include a 1940s time warp in Hampshire and an inspirational owner making dreams come true in Essex

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Three-legged labrador Dave seeks a new best friend, and his owners Laura and Paul hope that Luna, the beautiful but nervous saluki, will win Dave over. Nine-year-old stray westie called Norman gets much attention from mother and son Lorraine and Oliver - upsetting youngster Cynthia, a Staffie cross. Meanwhile, enthusiastic setter-poodle pup Obi might just win the chance to bring the joy and chaos that Mike and his partner Tracey don't yet know they need in their lives

programme.title: Bake Off: The Professionals
programme.desc: Ellie Taylor and Liam Charles welcome a new batch of pastry chefs to the tent and challenge them to create 36 individual opra aux fruit and one chocolate amenity in three hours. For their showpiece, the teams must transform a classic banoffee pie into a fine-dining experience with edible sculptures. Benoit Blin and Cherish Finden judge

programme.title: AI: Artificial Intelligence (2001)
programme.desc: A highly advanced robotic boy is created with one purpose - to love his owner as a parent. When he is rejected by his 'mother', he is left to roam the bleak landscapes of a futuristic America with a fellow android, searching for a means of becoming a real boy in the hope of regaining her love. Steven Spielberg's sci-fi drama, starring Haley Joel Osment, Jude Law, William Hurt and Frances O'Connor

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody: The Home County Cartel
programme.desc: Part two of two. The covert team tries to find the true identity of Jaguar Palace, as well as the evidence to link the suspect directly to the drug-importing conspiracy. The detectives begin a nerve-shredding wait for the criminal network to set up its lucrative operation again, and stand ready to strike against the ringleaders when it does

programme.title: Extraordinary Escapes with Sandi Toksvig
programme.desc: Sandi and comedian, actor and writer Roisin Conaty explore Wales from the Pembrokeshire Coast to the English boarder staying in the best retreats the country has to offer. Starting with Seren Mor near the Nevern Estuary, Roisin is blown away by the contemporary architecture and dogs on the beach. Electric bikes take the pair over to Powys where they stay at the Hergest Lee Cabin and Lean-To, styled with quirky design and mid-century furnishings. Finally, the pair top off their escape in Moor Tower, a refurbished folly by Hay on Wye just a mile from the Welsh boarder boasting views of the Black Mountains, The Brecon Beacons and the Wye Valley

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets artists Indi and Rebecca, who are planning to construct a modern, larch-clad home on the Isle of Skye, with a second hand-crafted building alongside to use as their studio, all on a tight budget of 150,000. They have been saving for years, but making it happen will mean taking on the savage weather, not to mention the sceptical locals - and as if that weren't enough, most of the work is being done by one man, local builder Donald

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon O'Brien and Henry Cole visit Witney in Oxfordshire, where Henry comes across a tractor that has not run for quite a few years - but poses no problem for restorer Alan

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Fitness fanatic Jen Edwards throws the first in a series of parties in Swansea, but despite claiming to be a confident cook, she fumbles with her choice of starter. After overcoming trouble in the kitchen, the first course goes down well, and the host decides to get her guests to work up an appetite for dessert with a Zumba dance workout

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Teacher James Knight hosts a school-themed party in Swansea, complete with children's games and bangers and mash. As well as entertaining his guests, James will have to keep tensions between Karen and Jen to a minimum if he is to stand a chance of winning the 1,000 prize at the end of the week

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Rugby player Keith Larrard hosts as the competition in Swansea reaches the midway point. He hopes to impress his guests with a Jackson 5 theme and a naked butler, but his guests are confused by a cryptic menu with dishes including Shoulder Sheep Sh'Moan

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Karen Wood hosts the fourth dinner party challenge in Swansea and hopes to impress not only with her buffet-style menu, but also by providing a hot tub. However, the diners' mixed expectations about her cooking skills, together with a series of mishaps during the day, mean the outcome is far from certain

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Solicitor Katherine Waldemar Brown hosts the final party of the competition in Swansea, and asks her guests to adhere to a tarts-and-vicars dress code. She hopes her sophisticated menu will impress her fellow diners, but the evening is threatened by their unruly behaviour. The winner of the 1,000 prize is then announced

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Retirees Kay and Barry have decided it's time to fulfil their dream of buying a holiday home in the historic city of Jerez in southern Spain. With a budget of 105,000, they want an apartment close to all the action. Jasmine Harman lines up five excellent properties for the pair to choose between

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Katrin and Thomas want a holiday home with a pool, mountain views and some land in the spectacular countryside of inland Mlaga. With a budget of 250,000, Danni Menzies sets out to find their dream place

programme.title: Bake Off: The Professionals
programme.desc: Ellie Taylor and Liam Charles welcome a new batch of pastry chefs to the tent and challenge them to create 36 individual opra aux fruit and one chocolate amenity in three hours. For their showpiece, the teams must transform a classic banoffee pie into a fine-dining experience with edible sculptures. Benoit Blin and Cherish Finden judge

programme.title: Venom (2018)
programme.desc: While exploring space for new worlds, a probe belonging to the Life Foundation discovers a comet covered in symbiotic lifeforms. Following the probe's return to Earth, journalist Eddie Brock investigates sinister trials being carried out by the corporation, and after being infected by an alien symbiote, develops superhuman strength and power. Fantasy adventure, starring Tom Hardy and Riz Ahmed

programme.title: In the Footsteps of Killers
programme.desc: Emilia Fox and criminologist Professor David Wilson focus on the disappearance of Suzy Lamplugh. The estate agent vanished after making an appointment with a client in July 1986. Despite the high profile of the case, nobody has ever been charged with Lamplugh's abduction and murder. Following a series of tantalising clues, Emilia and David narrow the field of suspects down to just one man. Will he reveal the truth?

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on the Eurovision Song Contest, Beat the Chasers, The Queen's Platinum Jubilee Celebration, Lovestruck High, The Repair Shop, Drag Me to Hell, and ITV News coverage of the Jubilee pudding

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts, as Roisin Conaty and Asim Chaudhry take on Jon Richardson and Josh Widdicombe. Bill Bailey is in Dictionary Corner. Regular Countdown mathematician Rachel Riley and lexicographer Susie Dent are on hand to adjudicate

programme.title: Britain's Most Expensive Houses
programme.desc: Sotheby's managing director Guy hopes to secure the listing of a 6.5million 14-bedroom, five-acre Grade II listed manor house mega home onto his books. Aston Tirrold in Oxfordshire boasts six reception rooms, a tennis court and a huge outdoor pool, and has been home to the same family since 1975. Broker Kenrick heads to Camden, north London, to try to secure the listing of an uber-modern glass building apartment with three bedrooms, three bathrooms and a 900-square-ft roof terrace

programme.title: Extraordinary Escapes with Sandi Toksvig
programme.desc: Sandi and comedian, actor and writer Roisin Conaty explore Wales from the Pembrokeshire Coast to the English boarder staying in the best retreats the country has to offer. Starting with Seren Mor near the Nevern Estuary, Roisin is blown away by the contemporary architecture and dogs on the beach. Electric bikes take the pair over to Powys where they stay at the Hergest Lee Cabin and Lean-To, styled with quirky design and mid-century furnishings. Finally, the pair top off their escape in Moor Tower, a refurbished folly by Hay on Wye just a mile from the Welsh boarder boasting views of the Black Mountains, The Brecon Beacons and the Wye Valley

programme.title: Untold: OnlyFans Got Me Fired
programme.desc: Sarah Jayne Dunn and other creators explain how their OnlyFans accounts were the reasons for losing their jobs. This documentary investigates the complexities, risks and potential embarrassment of doing adult video work alongside a traditional job as well as asking what rights adult-content-creators have in the workplace

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Model May Dudley hosts the final day of the culinary competition in Wolverhampton, and leaves the planning to her mother. The evening begins on a high, until serving the tiger-prawn starter proves stressful, and the winner of the 1,000 prize is announced

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In South Yorkshire, Phil and Kate get the contest started with a menu inspired by their most romantic meals. Day two sees loved-up bus drivers Lee and Dawn cooking up favourite dishes from their wedding day, before plant biologist Katie and micro-brewer Ed try to impress with a Spanish-inspired menu

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: At Chteau de la Fare, Janet and Philip start their biggest challenge yet - the creation of their largest guest suite, part of which will be in the medieval tower Over at Chteau de la Boutinire, Alison and Zion press to complete their first ever gite, and with a booking on the cards, the pressure is on to get it done in time

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Having both retired from the Army, Rachel and Steven Grey are hoping to find the perfect property on Costa Rica's Pacific Costa Ballena where they can run a small B&B. Sara Damergi shows them a variety of possible options for their 250,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: A range of properties in Bournemouth, Dorset, and Sicily provide food for thought for Paul and Chris, the owners of a B&B in northern France who are ready for a slower pace of life in a different country

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: In Alicante, Charlotte Rodriguez and her brother-in-law Damon are searching for a Spanish home for couple Lorraine and Martin from Lanarkshire. Having worked on several renovations in the past, Martin is keen to find somewhere that doesn't need any work, but his budget this time is just 175,000 euros. In Murcia, Darren and Natalie Brown are with fitness fanatics Chris and Cheryl from Glasgow. They're looking for a dream home in the sun that will work as a remote office and somewhere to share with all the family. They are fortunate to possess a healthy budget of 300,000 euros

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head to Tiverton in the West Country to meet petrolhead Roger. Henry finds part of a tornado jet that he wants to turn into a table, while Simon finds a pair of exhaust pipes, which he thinks could become a trendy pair of lamps

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Events manager Peter Ferguson hosts the first party in Edinburgh, but his guests are less than impressed with his pricey chateaubriand main course. After a gospel choir provides the evening's entertainment, one guest finds herself in trouble, leaving another diner speechless

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Alison Lynch hosts the dinner party in Edinburgh, and attempts to win her guests over with a ju-jitsu-themed evening. Rena Martin appears to be endearing herself to the group, and Cynthia Gentle impresses Gary Reid by telling him what she can do with a mango

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Beautician Cynthia Gentle hopes to win over her guests with a theme of 1950s glamour and an international menu, featuring a main course that includes crocodile, as she hosts the third dinner party in Edinburgh. Security firm boss Gary Reid decides to provoke a debate on fidelity, while tensions erupt between ju-jitsu teacher Alison Lynch and events manager Peter Ferguson

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Health worker Rena Martin opts for a decadent menu as she hosts the fourth dinner party in Edinburgh, but the rowdy atmosphere proves too much for one of the guests, who ends up asking for a taxi home

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Security manager Gary Reid hosts the final dinner party in Edinburgh, and installs cameras in his dining room to ensure he caters for his guests' needs. Alison Lynch and Peter Ferguson continue to argue, but tensions are forgotten over a cracker-eating game, before the winner of the 1,000 prize is announced

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Linda is looking for a holiday home in Paphos on the west coast of Cyprus, and has asked her sister Marie to and property expert Scarlette Douglas to join her in her search. But with a budget of 80,000 and a wish list they be able to find a property that ticks all the boxes?

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp is in the Home Counties with Harvie and Ranjit, who have had one of the longest searches she has ever tried to crack. With a staggering 1.6m budget, it seems like it should be simple but the couple confess to having viewed and rejected nearly 100 properties. Phil Spencer has a challenge of a different sort. Zosia and David have saved hard for their first home and have been living Zosia's parents while they search. They have their hearts set on the popular town of Hitchin and Phil thinks that might be partly why their 380,000 remains unspent

programme.title: Britain's Best Beach Huts
programme.desc: Jay Blades and Laura Jackson continue their hunt for Britain's most luxurious beach huts. Jay starts his journey in Dorset at Britain's most expensive beach huts, where a spot on the sand can set a buyer back a cool half a million pounds. He then heads to Scotland to a smugglers' tunnel to a secret beach hut on the shores of a private bay. Laura discovers a complete wellness centre contained in a handcrafted beach hut in Margate, Kent, before seeing how a building that was the birthplace of telecommunications now offers an extravagant beach hut escape on the west Wales coast

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets artists Indi and Rebecca, who are planning to construct a modern, larch-clad home on the Isle of Skye, with a second hand-crafted building alongside to use as their studio, all on a tight budget of 150,000. They have been saving for years, but making it happen will mean taking on the savage weather, not to mention the sceptical locals - and as if that weren't enough, most of the work is being done by one man, local builder Donald

programme.title: Five Star Kitchen: Britain's Next Great Chef
programme.desc: The semi-final finds the four remaining chefs put through their paces in their toughest challenge yet. First, they must present an opulent feasting centrepiece designed to attract groups of diners who are keen to splash the cash on a special occasion. The pressure mounts in the kitchen as the chefs are next challenged to cater an exclusive banquet for 100 VIP guests, with each chef producing one course - starter, fish, meat and dessert - under the watchful eye of global restaurateur Mike Reid

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Joe Lycett heads to the Austro-German border with his guest vacationer Roisin Conaty, spending a couple of days in the fairy-tale city of Salzburg. After checking in to the art-filled Blaue Ganz hotel, they hop into a horse and carriage for a tour of the city and an on-the-go three-course meal. They then embark on a forest-bathing workshop, attempting a series of exercises to reawaken their senses. Day two starts with a homage to Mozart. The duo reflect on the composer's music then sample the city's signature sweet, Mozartkulgen - aka Mozart Balls - a mix of nougat, marzipan and dark chocolate

programme.desc: Cameras focus on East London baker Lee, who has transferred his skills to Benidorm, where he is offering a British alternative to traditional Spanish baked goods

programme.desc: Two undercover officers try to get a suspect to return to a store to prove he paid, while police find more than they bargained for after catching two thieves

programme.desc: The return of the programme offering an insight into the work of officers patrolling the roads of Derbyshire. programme.desc: Graeme Hall meets a greedy Labrador called Bing that constantly scavenges for things to eat on walks. Meanwhile, Graeme also meets a German Shepherd that lunges towards any other dog it sees, which is causing owner Lesley a lot of anxiety whilst out on walks

programme.title: Cold Pursuit (2019)
programme.desc: An unassuming but hard-working snowplough driver abandons his quiet mountain life after his son is murdered by a powerful drug lord. Grieving, yet furious, he draws on his hunting skills to become an adept killer seeking out revenge against those responsible. Meanwhile, Hotch makes a connection with an attractive runner as they train for a triathlon. Charles S Dutton (Roc), Shawn Hatosy (Southland) and Bellamy Young (Dirty Sexy Money) guest star

programme.desc: Best friends Perry Gilbert and Mia Harris sneak into the woods with Mia's young sister Zoe in tow. Their search for the mythical Glasgowman leads to a series of violent events, leaving Zoe gravely injured and the other girls missing. Detectives Rollins and Carisi work to locate the suspect, while Benson digs through the stories to distinguish fantasy from reality. Crime drama, starring Mariska Hargitay, Kelli Giddish and Peter Scanavino

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The SVU detectives team up with their counterparts in the Chicago Intelligence Unit to take down a child-pornography ring. Crime drama, starring Mariska Hargitay and Ice-T

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs and the team capture computer hacker Ajay Khan, who was recently responsible for hacking into NCIS's supposedly ultra-secure multiple-threat alert centre. They believe he could hold the key to tracking down the most-wanted cyber terrorist in the world, who may be plotting an attack using a bomb containing a strain of the Ebola virus. When Khan refuses to co-operate, Ziva and DiNozzo take him to Guantanamo Bay to be placed with people he had previously betrayed. Guest starring Vik Sahay (Chuck)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the case of a marine who dropped dead while scaling a wall on an assault course, and a fellow soldier reveals that he was heavily involved with an underground fight club, where competitors would battle for cash. Meanwhile, having returned to work after compassionate leave, Vance discovers paperwork and a key in his late wife's effects that lead him to a safety deposit box containing a stash of cash

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: While transporting the corpse of Lt Gordon Roth to the morgue, a flat tyre brings Ducky and Jimmy to a halt and they are abducted and taken to a remote cabin - where one of their captors wants the post-mortem to take place. Back at the scene, Abby finds a blood sample that does not belong to the victim, who in fact bore little resemblance to the picture of Roth in his old school yearbook. Guest starring Valerie Cruz (The Following)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A woman is stabbed to death after stepping out of her shower, becoming the latest victim of the Dead Rose Slasher. Gibbs is approached by his old friend and barber Frankie Dean, who shares his concern that his son Cameron may be the killer. He explains that a photo-fit released to the media resembles him, and the attacks stopped during a period coinciding with his three-year stint in the navy. Meanwhile, Tony has to take probationary agent Ned Dorneget under his wing

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. However, an over-zealous attorney embarks on a crusade to make the information public knowledge, going so far as to take the officers to court in an effort to force them to reveal their source - but his interest in the case raises suspicions

Frank receives a message containing a threat to Mulrow's life unless the inmate is released and orders Danny to lead the hunt for the missing officer. Meanwhile, Jamie worries that his grandfather doesn't approve of his methods when Henry accompanies him on a ride-along

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Rollins makes a connection between a series of sexual assaults on young girls that have recently taken place, and some cases she worked on while back in Atlanta, but making a concrete link between the incidents proves difficult. Hard-hitting series chronicling the life and crimes of the New York Police Department, starring Mariska Hargitay

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: US Marine sergeant Teddy Lemere is killed by a sniper in Afghanistan just after his sniffer dog helps guide a young child out of a minefield. Back in the US, his widow Ruby tells Gibbs and the team that she had recently received a message from her husband saying he might have upset a few people. Abby retrieves a tiny shard of the sniper's bullet from Ted's helmet and finds that it was made in America

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A doctor dies on board the USS Borealis during a heavy storm and when the ship is brought into Norfolk Naval Yard, Ducky's investigation reveals a telltale mark on the victim's carotid artery, suggesting he was injected with poison. Initial inquiries focus on a petty officer with a history of drug use who may have wanted the doctor to remain silent about his problems. American drama, starring David McCallum

programme.title: NCIS

Meanwhile, Ziva ruffles a few feathers by insisting on continuing her investigation into the murder of her father, asking for permission to go to Rome on the trail of the chief suspect. Mark Harmon stars

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: New Mossad director Orli Elbaz asks for the team's help in finding Ilan Bodnar when one of her agents is shot dead in Virginia, telling Gibbs he was investigating several operatives who had gone rogue after Eli David's death. Ziva travels with Tony to Berlin in her pursuit of Bodnar, the man she believes was responsible for the death of her father. Guest starring Marina Sirtis (Star Trek: The Next Generation)

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV is helping to bring criminals using weapons to justice. A CCTV operator's instincts lead him to keep an eye on a man acting suspiciously on a train station platform and who then takes a knife out of his pocket and threatens a woman coming towards him. There is also footage of a raid on a west London jewellery shop, with the gang spraying bleach in the eyes of security guards and smashing down the doors with pickaxes while the terrified staff cower inside

Meanwhile, Richard Parsons from the Inspector General's office closes in on Ziva as he investigates the death of Ilan Bodnar, the man who killed her father. Guest starring Colin Hanks

Meanwhile, Richard Parsons tries to get Gibbs to take responsibility for the many unnecessary deaths for which he holds the NCIS team accountable

When attempts are made on the lives of Gibbs and Tony, it appears that all of the NCIS agents are in mortal danger. Starring Mark Harmon and Colin Hanks

programme.desc: Investigator McHugh finds a dog with a missing leg, and AJ is horrified to discover a puppy dying from a tick infestation

programme.title: Saving Lives at Sea
programme.desc: RNLI volunteers at Calshot on the south coast race to the rescue of a 180-metre-long cargo ship which has run aground on a sandbank, and is now listing at a dangerous angle. At the most northerly lifeboat station on the British mainland, the crew gets called out to investigate a personal locator beacon which has been set off on a remote stretch of rocky coastline, and in Kinsale, volunteers come to the aid of a horse

programme.title: The Yorkshire Auction House

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Experts Izzie Balmer and Tim Medhurst cruise around Wales in a classic car searching for antiques to sell at auction. Izzie finds a selection of maps from the days before cars ruled the road and Tim gets all excited when he discovers a William Gladstone commemorative medal. With shopping done there's time for the duo to learn more about local history, as Izzie finds out about a shameful event that took place in the country's capital city, Cardiff and Tim takes a trip to Carmarthen to learn about the poet and scholar who helped save the Welsh language from extinction

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip

programme.title: Talk to Al Jazeera
programme.desc: One-on-one conversations with global leaders, icons, influencers and alternative voices shaping our times.

programme.title: Pocket Dragon Adventures
programme.desc: A group of very small dragons live with a kindly old wizard, they're not big enough to fly but that doesn't stop them having many adventures

programme.title: Legend of the Dragon
programme.desc: The guardian of the temple has passed on and a new Golden Dragon must be Chosen from a brother and sister - Twins born in the Year of the Dragon. Only one will be chosen. Their sibling bond tested

programme.title: Roswell Conspiracies
programme.desc: The story of allied intelligence agents who've discovered aliens on Earth who are bent on taking over the world. In response, the agents form a top-secret multinational agency, The Global Alliance

programme.title: Extreme Dinosaurs
programme.desc: 65 Million years ago, Dinosaurs disappeared. Now they're Back! T-Bone, Spike, Bullzeye, and Stegz. Four prehistoric dinosaurs, evolved into intelligent beings reawaken in a bizarre new world

programme.title: Sooty
programme.desc: The gang is put in charge of Mr Slater's Pizza Parlour but Soo would rather be a top fashion designer like Valentino Du Prado

programme.title: Sooty
programme.desc: A mucky Sweep is told to take a bath and clean himself up - but he gets his paw stuck in the tap

programme.title: Underwater World for Kids
programme.desc: An underwater adventure that takes in the many natural wonders and magical sea creatures above and below our oceans.

programme.title: Dickensian
programme.desc: Period drama re-imagining the works of Charles Dickens as inter-connected tales, set in a fictional version of 19th-century London. The likes of Oliver Twist's Fagin and the Artful Dodger live alongside and interact with the wealthy Barbarys of Bleak House, and the homely Cratchitts of A Christmas Carol, in events that eventually set up the stories featured in their respective novels. The saga begins on Christmas Eve, as Amelia and Arthur Havisham gather to hear the reading of their father's will, and the ruthless nature of debt collector Jacob Marley appears to give someone a motive for murder. Starring Stephen Rea, Pauline Collins, Caroline Quentin, Tom Weston-Jones, Tuppence Middleton, Anton Lesser and Omid Djalili

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton returns to visit more islands off the coastline, beginning with the Outer Hebrides. He resumes his journey on Eriskay, where he discovers how the remote location helped preserve a unique way of life for centuries - and also allowed locals to hide thousands of bottles of whisky from the excise men when a ship laden with the thirst-quenching cargo ran aground in 1941. The story inspired the 1949 movie Whisky Galore! Moving on to Barra, Paul goes foraging for cockles and visits the only airport in the world where scheduled flights land on the beach, then heads across to Vatersay, where he joins local fishermen trawling for lobsters

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton explores the Isle of Mull and its satellite islands to discover why they have become boltholes from the hustle and bustle of the modern world. He begins on the tidal island of Erraid, which inspired famous Scottish writer Robert Louis Stevenson, then hops over to Ulva, the final resting place of Lachlan MacQuarrie, one of the first governors of New South Wales. He then explores Mull itself, being given a whistlestop tour of the island by rally driver Louise Thomas, then travels to the mysterious little island of Inch Kenneth, where he hears the story of Nazi sympathizer Unity Mitford. He ends his tour at the remote Treshnish Islands, where he experiences a spot of 'puffin therapy'

programme.title: Monkey
programme.desc: The King of the Unicorns steals Monkey's magic wishing staff, hoping to give it as a present to the son of the woman he's planning to marry

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: The crew is infected by a mysterious illness, and Tony must intervene before it is too late. Sci-fi adventure starring Martin Landau, Barbara Bain, Tony Anholt and Dave Prowse

programme.title: The Passing of the Third Floor Back (1935)
programme.desc: A mysterious Christ-like stranger arrives at a boarding house in London, and changes the residents' lives forever. Drama, starring Conrad Veidt, Rene Ray, Anna Lee and Frank Cellier

programme.title: Tarka the Otter (1978)
programme.desc: A mischievous otter faces a fight for survival in the wild from birth, as it leaves the nest and strikes out alone. Wildlife adventure based in Henry Williamson's novel, narrated by Peter Ustinov and starring Peter Bennett, Edward Underdown and Brenda Cavendish

programme.title: The Avengers
programme.desc: Steed and Mrs Peel visit a mysterious coastal town where several agents have recently vanished, and the locals are not what they may at first seem. Patrick Macnee and Diana Rigg star

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London.

programme.title: Ainsley's Gourmet Express
programme.desc: The chef demonstrates chicken tikka masala, potato pizza, prawn pizzinis and chocolate muffins

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: Finally after four years of renovation, the scaffolding around Big Ben is coming down

programme.title: The World's Most Incredible Hotels
programme.desc: The most extraordinary, iconic, and luxurious hotels ever built, taking in 26 destinations across 18 countries

programme.title: Growing Up Poor
programme.desc: First of a two-part documentary about youngsters facing poverty, beginning with three teenage girls who are on the cusp of adulthood and are all surviving on less than 10 a day. Bridie's ambition to join the Army depends on her staying out of trouble with the police, while 16-year-old Amber has fallen pregnant, and Shelby is currently on benefits, but hopes the work placement she is on will develop into a full-time job

programme.title: The Dark Horse (2014)
programme.desc: A bipolar chess champion is released from a psychiatric hospital with nowhere to go, so moves in with his gang member brother. Needing a purpose, he forms a club to teach his skills to a group of underprivileged youngsters, but struggles with the strain of being a role model, particularly when his nephew seems set to follow in his father's criminal footsteps. Fact-based drama, starring Cliff Curtis and James Rolleston

programme.title: Winter of Our Dreams (1981)
programme.desc: Prostitute Lou encounters her dead friend's ex, who wants to discover why she committed suicide. A relationship develops between them, but when Lou acquires her friend's diary, she realises to her horror that she is repeating the mistakes of the past. Drama, with Judy Davis and Bryan Brown

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours of Charlton, Greenwich, Plumstead. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay.

programme.title: Ainsley's Gourmet Express
programme.desc: The chef demonstrates chicken tikka masala, potato pizza, prawn pizzinis and chocolate muffins

programme.desc: A digest of news and events from across London from the past few days.

programme.desc: 'Current affairs affecting Londoners today and a look at the latest shows and films in the capital.

programme.title: Sooty
programme.desc: Richard discovers the park is due for inspection, so Sooty builds a robot to help him tidy up

programme.title: Sooty
programme.desc: The Lady Mayoress opens the park's new ghost train. Guest-starring Ann Widdecombe

programme.title: Underwater World for Kids
programme.desc: An underwater adventure that takes in the many natural wonders and magical sea creatures above and below our oceans

programme.title: Dickensian
programme.desc: Christmas Day arrives and news of Jacob Marley's murder dampens the festivities, giving Inspector Bucket a new investigation to pursue. Meanwhile, at Satis House, Amelia Havisham's mysterious rescuer makes another appearance. Period drama, weaving together the back-stories of some of Dickens' various tales, starring Stephen Rea, Tuppence Middleton and Ben Starr

programme.title: My Greek Odyssey
programme.desc: Peter Maneas journeys through some of the most spectacular Greek islands, exploring the rich culture, history and food of Greece while meeting the locals and those who live there

programme.title: The World's Most Incredible Hotels
programme.desc: The most extraordinary, iconic, and luxurious hotels ever built, taking in 26 destinations across 18 countries

programme.title: William and Mary
programme.desc: William has his hands full trying to retrieve a body from Frankfurt as a favour to his late cousin's ex-wife, while Kate anxiously awaits her letter from Oxford University - but a postal strike adds to the tension. Elsewhere, Mary is put in an awkward position at work when a pregnant woman's partner makes a pass at her and Molly is forced to acknowledge the severity of her illness after being told she needs radiotherapy. Romantic comedy drama, starring Martin Clunes, Hannah Waddingham, Peta Cornish, Julie Graham and Cheryl Campbell

programme.title: Black Jack (1979)
programme.desc: A rascally French sailor is saved from hanging in 18th-century Yorkshire and sets out on the road with an apprentice, rescuing a young girl from an asylum along the way. Ken Loach's period adventure, adapted from Leon Garfield's classic children's novel, starring Jean Franval, Stephen Hirst, Andrew Bennett and Louise Cooper

programme.title: It Always Rains on Sunday (1947)
programme.desc: A convict escapes from prison and heads for London's East End in search of his former lover, hoping she will give him a safe hiding place. She is now married with three children, and is torn between her loyalty to her family and her unresolved feelings for the fugitive. Crime drama based on Arthur La Bern's novel, starring Googie Withers and John McCallum

programme.title: Ainsley's Gourmet Express
programme.desc: The chef demonstrates chicken tikka masala, potato pizza, prawn pizzinis and chocolate muffins

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: Exploring legends of London to get to the bottom of what's fact and what's fiction

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London.

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton visits Gigha and Jura, two islands of the Inner Hebrides that are only a few miles apart but could not be more different. He begins at the Achamore Gardens on Gigha, which were created in the 1930s by the malted-drink millionaire James Horlick. He loved Gigha's mild climate so much that he bought the island and made it his home. Today Gigha is owned by the community, and many of its residents are incomers attracted by the opportunity to begin a new island life on this small and fertile place. Where Gigha is small, lush and verdant, Jura is rugged and awe-inspiring. Despite being one of Scotland's largest islands, just 200 people live there - alongside more than 5,000 deer

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton explores a string of islands off the west coast near Oban, visiting Kerrera, Seil and Eileach an Naoimh. The host travels on an original steam-powered puffer, finding out about the vital role such ships played in providing a link to the mainland, as well as visiting some of Scotland's oldest religious buildings

programme.title: Kate Humble: Off the Beaten Track
programme.desc: Return of the programme in which Kate and her Welsh sheepdog Teg explore Wales' countryside. She begins in North Wales, trying to climb the tallest man-made structure in the country to fix some loose cables on the Arfon Transmission Tower. Next, Kate learns how to overcome natural obstacles with the novel activity of packrafting - using a lightweight inflatable canoe. On the north-east coast, Kate meets a pack of dogs trained to carry out wildlife conservation by sniffing out endangered species, then on the north-west coast she digs and prepares a grave for a new resident who in death wants to give himself to help nature thrive

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Moonwalkers (2015)
programme.desc: A CIA agent travels to London in 1969 on a mission to recruit Stanley Kubrick to fake a moon landing - but is unable to locate the reclusive film-maker. A seedy rock band manager sees a chance to get rich by passing off his friend as Kubrick, but when the ruse is discovered, they have to actually shoot a fake moon landing. Comedy, starring Rupert Grint and Ron Perlman

programme.title: Resistance (2020)
programme.desc: Aspiring mime artist Marcel Marceau joins the French Resistance to save the lives of thousands of children orphaned at the hands of the Nazis, including Klaus Barbie, also known as The Butcher of Lyon. Writer/director Jonathan Jakubowicz's biopic, starring Jesse Eisenberg, Clemence Poesy and Matthias Schweighofer

programme.title: The Cat and the Canary (1978)
programme.desc: Friends and relatives of a dead millionaire gather for the reading of his will. A taped message from the deceased expresses his loathing of his legatees, and the conditions attached to the will are deliberately designed to have them at each other's throats. Moreover, it seems at least one of the potential beneficiaries is prepared to commit murder to guarantee getting the money. Thriller, starring Honor Blackman, Michael Callan and Edward Fox

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours for locals and tourists, exploring Elephant & Castle and Croydon. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing Brixton and Harmondsworth for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay
